Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled (usually around 2 minutes). Strain into a chilled coupe/martini glass and serve.
source unknown
notes: A boozy number that combines flavors of cognac and port, leaning on the sweet side of potent alcohol-forward flavor. Look for dry curacao / orange liqueur to keep down the sweet notes.

name: Bijou Cocktail
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Green Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Add ice to your Nick and Nora glass (our coupe/martini) with water and set aside. Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir for around two minutes. Dump cold water out of your glass and strain cocktail into your now chilled vessel.

Garnish with an olive or real maraschino cherry and serve.

Note: We have chose Harry Johnson's original recipe over Dale Degroffs re-balance because of the stronger chartreuse flavor profile without the lighter "watered down" feel of the additional gin.
1900 Harry Johnson's Bartenders Manual
notes: A bright chartreuse and and gin vibrancy with a good deal of potency. A balance of botanicals and herbs.

name: Blood & Sand
ingredients: [{'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Scotch'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cherry Heering Liqueur'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a shaker and shake for 12 seconds, strain into a coupe, old fashioned glass (on ice), or Nick & Nora glass, whichever you prefer. Flame an orange peel over the beverage, rub the peel on the edge of the glass, and drop it into the drink.
source unknown
notes: Peaty scotch notes mixed with vermouth and a light cherry finish

name: Bloody Mary
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Tomato Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Horseradish'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Tabasco sauce'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'Salt'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'Black pepper'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': "Scrappy's Firewater Tincture"}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Celery bitters'}]
recipe:
Build all ingredients in a cocktail shaker and shake for 10 seconds and strain over fresh ice into a tall glass. Garnish with celery stick and anything else you would love to see on top of your Bloody Mary.

Celery Bitters and Firewater Bitters optional ingredients that bring savory heat to your recipe.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Savory flavor of tomato, salt, spice and citrus with a bit of pepper

name: Blue Hawaii
ingredients: [{'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Blue Curacao'}, {'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sour mix'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake aggressively for 12 seconds, strain over crushed ice into a highball glass or hurricane glass. Optionally, blend the cocktail and dump into your glass instead.
source unknown
notes: Pineapple sweet and light sour finish, spirits are mostly hidden within the beverage

name: Boulevardier
ingredients: [{'amount': '37.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Campari'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Chill your old fashioned glass with ice and water and set aside. Add all ingredients with ice to a mixing glass and stir for 2 minutes. Dump your chilled water from the old fashioned glass and strain into chilled glass.

Rub an orange twist around the rim of the glass and drop into the glass. Serve.
Harry MacElhone / Harry's New York Bar
notes: Slightly sweeter than a negroni that brings the rye intensity followed by a campari bitter bite that lingers.

name: Brooklyn
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dry Vermouth'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and stir for up to 2 minutes until well chilled. Strain into a chilled martini glass, coupe or nick & nora and serve.

The original recipe calls for Amer Picon or angostura bitters, but the most reasonable substitution is orange bitters because it is widely available.
source unknown
notes: A dry forward flavor with a subtle rye to add a mild sweetness, the maraschino liqueur is quite muted but ties the flavors together.

name: Caipiroska / Capivodka
ingredients: [{'amount': '0.5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Lime, Quartered'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'White granulated sugar'}]
recipe:
Put lime quarters in the bottom of an Old Fashioned glass and add sugar over the lime quarters. Muddle the lime with the sugar using a muddler as this will score the lime skin against the sugar grains and extract additional oils from the skin.

Once the limes are crushed into the sugar grains, fill the glass three quarters full with crushed ice then fill with vodka and give it a stir.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Sweet lime and light flavor of ethanol, slight limeade flavor

name: Cape Codder
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '135.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cranberry Juice'}]
recipe:
Build over ice in a tall glass and garnish! We suggest cranberry juice cocktail for this drink, one with a bit of sugar to tame the tart (not fresh pressed cranberries).
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Cranberry sweet and tart with a slight kick

name: Champagne Cocktail
ingredients: [{'amount': '180.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Champagne / Sparkling Wine'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Sugar Cube'}]
recipe:
Add dashes of bitters to your sugar cube and place in the bottom of a champagne glass. Pour champagne/prosecco/sparkling wine into your wine glass.

Garnish and serve!
source unknown
notes: Champagne forward with slight nuance of allspice, cinnamon and clove.

name: Chartreuse Martini
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Green Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dry Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds and strain into a chilled nick & nora glass or martini glass.
source unknown
notes: Herbal with muted anise flavor, lightly dry vermouth finish

name: Chicago South Side
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '7', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Mint Leaves'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients vigorously in a cocktail shaker (including mint) for 10 seconds and double strain into a chilled coupe glass, garnish with 1 mint leaf.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Lovely aromatic flavor of trade spices, gin botanicals and acidity. Just a great drink.

name: Chrysanthemum
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dry Vermouth'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Benedictine'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}]
recipe:
Stir all ingredients in a mixing glass until chilled (up to 2 minutes) and strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish. Use a good vermouth on this cocktail.
Hugo Ensslin
notes: Flavorful vermouth pairs with the sweetness of Benedictine; floral and well balanced with a muted black licorice finish

name: Clover Club
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Raspberry Syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Egg White'}]
recipe:
Dry shake all ingredients (without ice) for 15 seconds, add ice and shake again for 10 seconds; strain into a chilled coupe glass, garnish with 3 raspberries on a spear.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Raspberry sweetness mingled with floral juniper with a light dry citrus mid-palate that finishes sweet and silky with raspberries and gin.

name: Corpse Reviver #2
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cointreau'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Lillet Blanc'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}]
recipe:
Add absinthe to chilled coupe and swirl it around the glass and discard remaining absinthe (known as a "rinse"). Build remaining ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into chilled coupe and serve.
source unknown
notes: An herbal sour bite that will wake you up with a bit of aromatic gin/juniper aroma with a bit of a fennel mid-palate flavor.

name: Daiquiri
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'Salt'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into your cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe glass or over ice into an old fashioned glass and enjoy. Optional garnish would include a lime twist.

We call for "rum", generically, because the daiquiri works with all your favorites from a light rum to an aged rum or even a Demerara rum.
Common Man Cocktails
notes: Refreshing sour bite with a lingering lime flavor with an overall backbone of beautiful rum.

name: Dirty Martini
ingredients: [{'amount': '75.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dry Vermouth'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Olive Brine'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Olive'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and stir for 30 seconds to 2 minutes. Strain into a chilled nick and nora glass and garnish with one or three olives.
source unknown
notes: Bright gin flavor against a light salty brine, yet still gin forward with an off-dry finish.

name: Doctor Funk
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Grenadine'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Club Soda'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients except club soda with ice for 15 seconds. Dump shaker contents into pilsner glass, tiki mug or favorite drinking vessel. Top with club soda, add more ice if needed.
Intoxica by Jeff Berry
notes: Lemonade and Good & Plenty candy, a light and refreshing sour against black licorice

name: French 75
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Champagne / Sparkling Wine'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients (except Champagne) vigorously in a cocktail shaker for 10 seconds and strain into a champagne flute. Top with champagne and garnish with a lemon twist, serve.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Citrus and sparkling wine beginning into a slight off-dry floral mid-palate finishing with a lingering sweet malty citrus.

name: Gin & Tonic
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '150.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Tonic Water'}]
recipe:
In a tall glass, pour gin over cubes of ice. Squeeze a lime wedge and drop it into the glass followed by tonic water and serve.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Light and refreshing juniper notes with a creeping tonic bite that finishes clean.

name: Gin and Juice
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '82.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '82.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}]
recipe:
Add ice to a tall glass, add gin and juice. You can select your own "juice", but our recipe is slightly more unique than a simple greyhound (grapefruit juice).
source unknown
notes: Flavorful citrus juice blend with muted / hidden gin flavor

name: Gin Fix
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rich simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients vigorously in a cocktail shaker for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass or martini glass. Garnish with a orange slice and serve.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Tastes like alcoholic lemonade

name: Gin Fizz
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Club Soda'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Egg White'}]
recipe:
Dry shake all ingredients except club soda (without ice) for 15 seconds, add ice and shake again for 10 seconds; strain over ice into a lowball glass. Top with Club Soda. Serve immediately.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Smooth and silky lemon flavor with muted notes of juniper and a dry finish

name: Gin Gimlet
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients vigorously in a cocktail shaker for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass and garnish.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Simple taste of gin and lime with more tart than sour.

name: Gin Martini
ingredients: [{'amount': '75.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dry Vermouth'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Olive'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir for 30 seconds. Using a julep strainer (or hawthorne strainer if it fits), strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass. Optional olive (or 3) as garnish.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Potent gin botanical attack, fortified wine and an off-dry finish

name: Greyhound
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}]
recipe:
Build over ice in a tall glass and serve. If there is extra room in the glass, you can always double the ratio to fill out the glass.

Prior to 1945, in the United States at least, most cocktails contained gin instead of vodka so many classics like the Greyhound were gin-based utilizing similar ratios.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: A tart grapefruit flavor profile with mild potency hidden well in the juice.

name: Hanky Panky
ingredients: [{'amount': '52.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '52.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Fernet Branca'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled (usually up to 2 minutes). Strain into a chilled martini glass, add an orange twist, and serve.
Ada Coleman
notes: A smooth sweetness, brown sugar that moves into Eucalypus, citrus with forward-vermouth finish. Very manhattan like in flavor design.

name: Harvey Wallbanger
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Galliano L Autentico'}]
recipe:
Add ice to your tall glass and follow it up with vodka and fresh squeezed orange juice. Float Galliano on top, add a straw and garnish. Serve.
source unknown
notes: Imagine the screwdriver with a bit of herbal sweetness. Yep, orange juice, spirit and a hint of black licorice in the finish.

name: Hemingway Daiquiri
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to an iced cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe/cocktail glass and serve.

Also been called Daiquiri #3.
source unknown
notes: Light sour lime against herbal maraschino sweetness and a mild yet muted rum flavor. Easy to drink, good balance.

name: Hot Toddy
ingredients: [{'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Bourbon'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '180.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Boiling Water'}]
recipe:
Prepare your mug by adding additional boiling water to your mug to warm it up quickly. Once warm/hot empty your mug and add lemon juice, honey bourbon (or regular bourbon) and top with hot water.

To prepare a studded lemon peel, cut your peel and poke 3 whole cloves through the peel and add it to your drink. Add a cinnamon stick and serve.

If you do not have honey bourbon we suggest your favorite bourbon and, if you desire honey, add a bar spoon of honey to your finished drink and stir (helps to remove it from the spoon as well).
Common Man Cocktails
garnish: Studded Lemon Peel and Cinnamon Stick
notes: Warm citrus, alcohol (especially from the hot fumes) and honey, just as one would expect.

name: Hotel Nacional
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apricot Brandy'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds aggressively (to build a nice pineapple foam). Strain into a chilled coupe glass and serve.

Alternatively this works great with a dark rum.
source unknown
notes: A bold rum flavor balanced against tropical pineapple and apricot, a floral slightly delicate sour

name: Hurricane
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Rum'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Grenadine'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into an iced Hurricane Glass or Hi-Ball. Garnish and serve.
source unknown
notes: A flavorful fruit blend with a tart profile and a mild sour bite.

name: Irish Coffee
ingredients: [{'amount': '240.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Brown Sugar'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Irish Whiskey'}]
recipe:
Fill mug with hot water to preheat it, then empty. Pour hot coffee into the warm glass to about 3/4 full and then stir in brown sugar until dissolved. Add your Irish Whiskey of choice, and top with whipped cream. Serve hot.
source unknown
notes: Coffee, with a mild irish whiskey, with a modest bitterness

name: Lion's Tail
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Allspice dram / liqueur'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all your ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and give it a hardy shake for 15 seconds, strain into a coupe glass or nick and nora glass. Garnish with a slice of orange or other citrus.
The Café Royal Cocktail Book (1937)
notes: An off-dry flavor of bourbon, allspice finish that's well balanced with acidity.

name: Madras
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cranberry Juice'}]
recipe:
Build over ice in a tall glass and garnish with an orange wheel and serve. Alternatively, you can layer the ingredients with orange juice, cranberry juice, and a vodka float to give it a pretty presentation (although slightly disjointed taste).
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Tropical like flavor with beautiful citrus paired with tart cranberry and lightly sweet pressed oranges.

name: Manhattan
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass halfway filled with ice. Stir until well-chilled and strain into a chilled coupe or martini glass. Garnish with a cherry.
source unknown
notes: Mild sweetness with a musky rye flavor and a hint of fortified wine

name: Margarita
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Tequila'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Agave nectar'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orange Liqueur'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into your cocktail shaker with ice. Shake for 15 seconds and strain over ice into an old fashioned glass and garnish. Optionally, rim your glass with salt.

For a slightly sweeter experience, utilize crushed ice to chill down the cocktail faster and colder. For a more sour experience, tailer back your agave nectar by a quarter ounce (or 7.5ml).
Common Man Cocktails
notes: Agave forward flavor, mingled with citrus and bright tequila notes.

name: Martinez
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Old Tom Gin'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients vigorously in a cocktail shaker for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Stong potent start mixed with orange and subtle juniper with a mid-palate and finish that lingers bitter, tart and powerful.

name: Mojito
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'barspoons', 'name': 'Casters sugar (superfine sugar)'}, {'amount': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Mint Leaves'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Club Soda'}]
recipe:
Add your lime wedges and sugar to your tall glass, and muddle them together. Slap ('spank') your mint and add it into your glass over your muddled lime and sugar. Give it a gentle muddle without tearing your mint.

Add crushed ice over the ingredients until you're about halfway up the glass. Then top with light rum and integrate the ingredients by stirring with a bar spoon.

Top with additional crushed ice and top with club soda. Add your garnish and a straw and serve.
source unknown
notes: Light and refreshing sweet mint and sour lime bite with a light rum backend flavor.

name: Monte Carlo
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Benedictine'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir for 30 seconds to a minute, strain over fresh ice into a lowball glass, or straight up into a coupe glass.
source unknown
notes: Light notes of honey meets spicy notes of rye for a delicious balance

name: Moscow Mule
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Beer'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}]
recipe:
Build in a copper mug (for tradition) or old fashioned glass if no mug is available and add your garnish.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Spicy ginger zing with a refreshing citrus flavor, not too complex but great for pool side, hot weather and parties.

name: Nacional Daiquiri
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apricot Brandy'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Peach Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients with ice into a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a lime wedge.
Hotel Nacional, Havana Cuba
notes: Warm rum and citrus with a hint of peach in the finish; great balance of sweet against sour.

name: Negroni
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Campari'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Build over ice in a double old fashioned glass and garnish with half a wheel of orange.
source unknown
notes: Very bitter cocktail with a strong alcohol-forward flavor profile. A lingering bitter bite.

name: New York Sour
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Egg White'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Red Wine'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients but red wine to a cocktail shaker without ice and dry shake aggressively for 15 seconds. Add ice to your shaker and shake again for 15 seconds and strain over ice into an old fashioned glass. Float red wine on top and serve.
source unknown
notes: Smooth flavor, dry finish. Lightly fruity red wine against oak-driven flavor profile with a nice acidity.

name: Old Fashioned
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Sugar Cube'}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Luxardo Maraschino Cherry'}]
recipe:
Add sugar cube to an old fashioned glass and soak it with bitters of your choice (we prefer Boy Drinks World Walnut Bitters but you can use Angostura as well).

Once you've added your bitters to the sugar, muddle the sugar cube into the glass with a muddler and then pour your rye (or bourbon) into the glass. Add a couple cubes of ice and stir to dilute ice down a bit and integrate the bitter sugars.

Optionally, garnish with an orange wheel and maraschino cherry.
source unknown
notes: Forward rye flavor with muted bitters; simple.

name: Paloma
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Blanco Tequila'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '180.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Grapefruit Soda'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'Salt'}]
recipe:
Rim a highball with salt and add ice. Follow through with tequila, lime juice and top with your grapefruit soda. Some grapefruit soda may make your Paloma pink, others a tint of yellow.

More advanced / tequila lovers may reduce the grapefruit soda ratio to 4 ounces (120ml) to bring out more tequila notes.
source unknown
notes: Light and carbonated grapefruit with a hint of agave

name: Planter's Punch
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Grenadine'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds and strain into a chilled coupe glass. Use your favorite dark rum for this recipe, we love Plantation Original Dark for this build.
source unknown
notes: Foamy Fruity flavors mingled with molasses forward dark rum with a juicy tropical loveliness.

name: Ramos Gin Fizz
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Heavy Cream'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Orange Flower Water'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Egg White'}, {'amount': 'null', 'unit': 'null', 'name': 'Club Soda'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients except your ice and club soda to a shaker and shake it without ice (dry shake) for 15 seconds as aggressive as possible. Add ice and shake for 15 seconds or more and strain into a collins glass without ice. Top with club soda and serve.
source unknown
notes: Pure herbal gin and citrus forward flavor and aroma

name: Rob Roy
ingredients: [{'amount': '75.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Scotch'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Luxardo Maraschino Cherry'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled (usually about 2 minutes). Strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.
Waldorf Astoria
notes: Spirit forward flavor, lots of scotch comes through from start to finish; slight peaty smoke (or heavy if you use an Islay Scotch)

name: Rum Runner
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Chambord / Raspberry Liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Banana liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'splash', 'name': 'Grenadine'}]
recipe:
Add everything into a cocktail shaker and shake it all for 10 to 15 seconds and strain into a tall glass. Garnish with an orange wheel.
source unknown
notes: Raspberry candy with a little banana filling; This is a potent number, you can taste the alcohol.

name: Rusty Nail
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Drambuie'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Blended Scotch Whisky'}]
recipe:
Add both ingredients to an old fashioned glass and stir. You can serve with ice or "neat" depending on your preference (but chill the glass if you're going to serve it neat).
source unknown
notes: Scotch with honey like sweetness of Drambuie.

name: Salty Dog
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'barspoons', 'name': 'Course Sea Salt'}]
recipe:
Rim a tall glass with salt and set aside. Shake gin and grapefruit juice vigorously in a cocktail shaker for 10 seconds and strain over ice into your tall rimmed glass. Garnish with a quarter slice of grapefruit and serve.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Light flavor of juniper and lightly tart fleshy grapefruit flavor.

name: Sazerac
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Sugar Cube'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': "Peychaud's Bitters"}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}]
recipe:
Add absinthe to your chilled old fashioned glass, and move it around the base of the glass and along the sides (known as a "rinse") and pour the remaining out. Set glass aside.

Muddle sugar and bitters in a mixing glass and then add rye whiskey. Add ice and stir to chill down for about 2 minutes. Strain into rinsed old fashioned glass; use lemon twist to express oils over drink and on glass. Discard lemon twist.

Note: It's not a mistake, a sazerac isn't served on ice. Just a chilled old fashioned glass.
Antoine Amedie Peychaud
notes: Spicy rye with a backend hint of anise/fennel and a slight sweetness.

name: Screwdriver
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '135.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}]
recipe:
Build over ice in a tall glass and add your garnish. Works best with fresh squeezed orange juice.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Light and refreshing orange juice flavor with a mild kick

name: Sea Breeze
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cranberry Juice'}]
recipe:
Build over ice in a tall glass and garnish with lime wedge and serve. Fresh grapefruit juice will give this a smooth mild tartness vs. a more aggressive tartness from bottled grapefruit juice.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: A tart bite, mild sour with an off-dry finish; vodka does not play a big role.

name: Sidecar
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Brandy / Cognac'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orange Liqueur'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over ice into an old fashioned or into a chilled (no ice) nick & nora glass and garnish.

The recipe balance can be done in many ways and has been over the years. You can also try a 2:1:1 balance or even a 3:2:2 ratio of strong to sweet/sour.
Harry's ABC of Mixing Cocktails
notes: A driving lemon and brandy/cognac forward flavor, with a mild sweet and a citrus sour. Not as much brandy as some recipe ratios propose.

name: Singapore Sling
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cherry Heering Liqueur'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cointreau'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Benedictine'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Grenadine'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}]
recipe:
Add ingredients to a shaker tin with ice and shake for 10 seconds and dump entire shaker contents into a hurricane glass and serve.

Note:If you don't have hurricane glasses, use a standard highball glass for this recipe. Owning a hurricane glass just for this (and potentially a hurricane cocktail) may be overkill.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Tropical flavors of almond, brown sugar, cherry, pineapple and an array of sweetness.

name: Sloe Gin Fizz
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sloe Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Egg White'}, {'amount': 'null', 'unit': 'null', 'name': 'Club Soda'}]
recipe:
Add all but club soda into your cocktail shaker. Because we're using egg white, dry shake (with no ice) the cocktail aggressively for 20 seconds. Add ice cubes and shake for an additional 15 seconds and strain into your tall glass and top with 2 oz - 3 oz Club Soda.

Optionally pour over ice if you want a slightly colder beverage.
source unknown
notes: Dry berry flavor, brown sugar with a light off-dry and tart finish.

name: Southside
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'American Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Mint Leaves'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients vigorously in a cocktail shaker (including mint) for 10 seconds and double strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a single mint leaf.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: A sour-forward gin flavored design with subtle mint flavor.

name: Spiked Eggnog
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Brandy / Cognac'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Heavy Cream'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Syrup / Mix'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}]
recipe:
Chill your old fashioned glass with ice and water. Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker without ice and aggressively shake for 15 seconds. Add ice to your cocktail shaker and shake for another 15 seconds.

Dump your ice and water from your glass and strain contents of shaker into a chilled glass. Garnish and serve.
source unknown
notes: Creamy eggnog with a lightly burning alcohol, lightly sweet balanced against a rum finish. A bit chalky aftertaste.

name: Steve's Rum Barrel
ingredients: [{'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Syrup / Mix'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Jamaican rum'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Almond Extract'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to an immersion blender with crushed ice, dump into a tiki mug. For Pernod (Absinthe) do 6 drops (roughly 1 dash), for almond extract, do 3 drops (or around that, maybe a dash)
Jeff Berry's REMIXED
notes: A bit strong on potency, a mild bitter, not too sweet, not too sour, lots of tropical flavor with a light honey finish

name: Tequila Sour
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Reposado Tequila'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Agave nectar'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Bittercube Chipotle Cacao Bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Egg White'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker and dry shake (without ice) aggressively for 15 seconds. Add ice and shake again for 15 seconds then double strain into an old fashioned glass (ice optional). Add three dots of bitters for presentation and serve.
source unknown
notes: Lightly dry citrus meets agave with cinnamon spice, cacao and lingering tequila.

name: The Dorchester
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients vigorously in a cocktail shaker for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass or martini glass. Garnish with a grapefruit twist and serve.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Floral forward herbal flavor, mid-palate citrus acidity, finishing of juniper, sweet herbaceous linger.

name: The Last Word
ingredients: [{'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Green Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe or nick & nora glass.
Rediscovered by Murray Stenson, Zig Zag Cafe
notes: A balanced herbal forward cocktail that doesn't lean towards sour, and has hints of sweetness.

name: The Vesper
ingredients: [{'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Lillet Blanc'}]
recipe:
Chill a large coupe glass with water and ice; set aside.

Add cocktail ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake aggressively for 10 seconds. Dump ice and water from your glass and double strain (to remove ice shards) contents of the shaker into your chilled glass.

Garnish with a lemon peel and serve.

If you can't find Lillet Blanc, you can substitute Cocchi Americano.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Strong and direct gin with a hint of bitter bite; not for the weak at heart.

name: Tom Collins
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Old Tom Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Club Soda'}]
recipe:
Build over ice in a tall glass and top with soda water and gently stir; garnish with a lemon slice, serve.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Refreshing yet sour start with a mildly sweet tart gin ending with bubbly citrus and a lingering sour lemon

name: Vodka Collins
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Club Soda'}]
recipe:
Build over ice in a tall glass and top with soda water and gently stir; garnish with a lemon slice and cherry, serve. Vodka is a rather flavorless core spirit so consider club soda over seltzer water in this drink to give this cocktail a bit of added nuance.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Light and refreshing lemonade like appeal, with a kick of alcohol in the finish.

name: Whiskey Smash
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Mint Leaves'}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Lemon Wedges'}]
recipe:
Cut a half lemon into wedges. In a shaker, muddle the lemon with the simple syrup. Add mint leave and perform a more gentle muddle. Add the remaining ingredients with ice and shake. Dump ice and ingredients into a double old fashioned and add more ice as necessary.
source unknown
notes: Warm buttery oak, citrus, mint, light touch of vanilla notes in the finish. Whiskey brand dictates profile.

name: Whiskey Sour
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Egg White'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'Salt'}]
recipe:
Add ingredients to a shaker tin with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled lowball glass and serve. Egg White is optional (technically that makes it a Boston Sour, but it's a fantastic edition).

If using egg whites, use the dry shake method (shake all ingredients without ice aggressively for 20-seconds then add ice and shake for 15 seconds).
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: A mingling of citrus and whiskey and a silky smooth texture that ends off-dry.

name: White Lady
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orange Liqueur'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Egg White'}]
recipe:
Dry shake all ingredients (without ice) for 15 seconds, add ice and shake again for 10 seconds; strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Smooth timid start of citrus, growing juniper mid-palate mingled with lemon with a dry citrus finish.

name: White Russian
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Kahlua Coffee Liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Half and Half / Cream'}]
recipe:
Build over ice in an old fashioned glass, adding your cream/milk/half-and-half last so it builds a neat presentation. Optionally, add nutmeg to the top as a garnish.

Some folks opt to shake and strain this beverage, which works perfectly fine as well. You may also opt to swap Half & Half for cream for a thicker consistency or milk for a thinner consistency.
source unknown
notes: Classic coffee cream flavor with muted vodka notes, reduced by the overall fat content.

name: Woo Woo
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Peach Schnapps'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cranberry Juice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass or Martini Glass and serve.

Optionally, for a “tall drink”, double the recipe and build it over ice in a Hi-Ball Glass or Collins Glass.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Peach-forward flavor with a tart finish of cranberry, ethanol hides well.

name: Apricot Sour
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apricot Brandy'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Luxardo Maraschino Cherry'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker without ice and shake aggressively for 20 seconds. Add your ice to the shaker and shake for another 15 seconds. Strain over ice into an old fashioned glass and serve.
source unknown
notes: Starts sweet, ends off-dry and has a lovely mouth feel; well balanced and tasty.

name: Cynar Flip
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Canadian Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cynar'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cointreau'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Clove Simple Syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Bittertruth Jerry Thomas Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake aggressively for one minute and strain (or double strain) into a coupe glass.
source unknown
notes: Silky mouthfeel, lightly sweet, nice moderate bitterness

name: Java Tai
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Averna Amaro'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Black Coffee'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}]
recipe:
Brew strong coffee / espresso and let it cool. Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and "dry shake" (without ice) for 20 seconds aggressively. Add ice to your cocktail shaker and shake for an additional 15 seconds and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
source unknown
notes: Deliciously silky smooth coffee flavor, like a coffee milk with no alcohol taste.

name: Kentucky Chocolate
ingredients: [{'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Demerara Simple Syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sour mix'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Chocolate Bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}]
recipe:
Add all all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and dry shake (no ice) for 20 seconds aggressively. Add ice to the shaker and shake again for 15 seconds and strain over ice into an old fashioned glass.

Optionally garnish with a lemon wheel.

Works fantastic with a higher proof bourbon, we typically build with Elijah Craig Bourbon.
Jennifer Schommer
notes: A creamy, silky texture with oak, vanilla and with a good deal of dark chocolate flavor; a chocolate whiskey sour of sorts.

name: Rattlesnake
ingredients: [{'amount': '52.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Demerara Simple Syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Egg White'}]
recipe:
Add ingredients to a shaker tin with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled lowball glass or 8 oz coupe glass and serve. When working with egg whites, use the dry shake method (shake all ingredients without ice aggressively for 20-seconds then add ice and shake for 15 seconds).
Will Elliott, Maison Premiere, New York City
notes: Rye whiskey spice, black licorice with an off-dry finish.

name: Sloe Gin Fizz
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sloe Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Egg White'}, {'amount': 'null', 'unit': 'null', 'name': 'Club Soda'}]

Optionally pour over ice if you want a slightly colder beverage.

notes: Dry berry flavor, brown sugar with a light off-dry and tart finish.

name: Tequila Sour
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Reposado Tequila'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Agave nectar'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Bittercube Chipotle Cacao Bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Egg White'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker and dry shake (without ice) aggressively for 15 seconds. Add ice and shake again for 15 seconds then double strain into an old fashioned glass (ice optional). Add three dots of bitters for presentation and serve.

notes: Lightly dry citrus meets agave with cinnamon spice, cacao and lingering tequila.

name: Uncle Angelo's Eggnog
ingredients: [{'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Spiced Rum'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'White granulated sugar'}, {'amount': '480.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Whole Milk'}, {'amount': '240.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Heavy Cream'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}]
recipe:
Split Yolk and egg white into separate bowls.
Beat egg yolks and fold in 3 tsp of sugar as you beat.
Stir in milk, heavy cream, bourbon, and rum into your egg yolk mixture. Add a few pinches of fresh grated nutmeg as well.
Using a drink mixer or separate bowl/whisk, beat your egg whites and remaining sugar until they form a soft peak.
Fold a third of the egg whites into the yolk mixture with a spoon.
Pour into your serving glasses, top with a bit more egg white and a little additional nutmeg.
Service around 6 drinks in single recipe "serving."
Note: Use real sugar, not simple syrup (2 oz of sugar equals 1/4 cup)
Dale Degroff
notes: Eggnog with a warm nutmeg and light alcohol warmth, fantastic creaminess

name: Alaskan Duck Fart
ingredients: [{'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee Liqueur'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Irish Cream'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Canadian Whiskey'}]
recipe:
Pour coffee liqueur into the bottom of your shot glass and layer Irish cream on top. Weakly layer your Canadian whiskey over the Irish cream, it can mix/sink a bit into the Irish cream give the proper presentation.
Dave Schmidt
notes: A light burn from the Whiskey, a bit of a "mudslide" taste profile (coffee/chocolate/cream), slightly sweet

name: Espresso Vodka Martini
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee Liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh Brewed Coffee / Espresso'}]
recipe:
Brew a pot of fresh coffee or espresso (if you like your drinks strong) and let it cool. Add coffee liqueur and vodka in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Strain into a martini glass and top with fresh coffee.

For a more potent coffee flavor, use cold brewed coffee.
source unknown
notes: Rich coffee notes, very direct coffee flavor without much else; great for coffee lovers!

name: Frozen Mudslide
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee Liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Irish Cream'}, {'amount': '180.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vanilla Ice Cream'}]
recipe:
Add two scoops of vanilla ice cream (around 6 ounces) and remaining ingredients to a blender with ice and blend until smooth (roughly 10-15 seconds). Garnish your old fashioned glass with chocolate syrup swirls and pour into your glass.

Optionally add chocolate shavings and whipped cream.
source unknown
notes: Chocolate milk blended with a cafe latte, great after dinner or before dinner beverage in warm weather.

name: Irish Coffee
ingredients: [{'amount': '240.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Brown Sugar'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Irish Whiskey'}]
recipe:
Fill mug with hot water to preheat it, then empty. Pour hot coffee into the warm glass to about 3/4 full and then stir in brown sugar until dissolved. Add your Irish Whiskey of choice, and top with whipped cream. Serve hot.
source unknown
notes: Coffee, with a mild irish whiskey, with a modest bitterness

name: Java Tai
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Averna Amaro'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Black Coffee'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}]
recipe:
Brew strong coffee / espresso and let it cool. Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and "dry shake" (without ice) for 20 seconds aggressively. Add ice to your cocktail shaker and shake for an additional 15 seconds and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
source unknown
notes: Deliciously silky smooth coffee flavor, like a coffee milk with no alcohol taste.

name: Krakatoa
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apricot Brandy'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee Liqueur'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Falernum Syrup'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Use fresh ice, crushed ice or dump the old ice from your cocktail shaker into your highball glass and serve. Garnish with fresh fruit if you so desire. It's tiki, get crazy.
source unknown
notes: Coffee notes right up front, citrus to follow with mingling clove; a tropical coffee beverage with interesting flavors.

name: Mind Eraser
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee Liqueur'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Club Soda'}]
recipe:
Add coffee liqueur and vodka over ice into a tall glass and top with club soda. Straw and serve.
source unknown
notes: Bitter coffee bite. Maybe some sweetness if you try to imagine it.

name: Spanish Coffee
ingredients: [{'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Overproof Rum / 151'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Triple sec'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee Liqueur'}, {'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Hot Coffee'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Whipped Cream'}]
recipe:
Rim mug with a thick later of sugar using lime juice or water to stick sugar to the rim (inside and out.) Once the sugar is stuck and slightly solidified add 151 to your mug along side orange liqueur / triple sec.

Now, light your liquid on fire and tip your mug carefully so it begins to caramelize the sugars along the inside of the rim. Continue to roll along the sides so the flame licks the sugar rim and warms it.

Add a few dashes of nutmeg (so it lights up and sparks). Add kahlua, which will put out the fire (or, put it out on your own if it doesn't go out.) Then top with coffee. Float whipped cream on top.
Jeffery Morgenthaler
notes: Warm dark roast coffee with a balanced sweetness and a punch of ethanol on the tongue.

name: Third Rail
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': "Gosling's Black Seal Rum"}, {'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Black Coffee'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Agave nectar'}, {'amount': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Ginger Pieces'}]
recipe:
Muddle ginger with agave and lime, add remaining ingredients to an iced cocktail shaker. Shake for 15 seconds and strain into an old fashioned glass.
Apotheke
notes: Coffee, blackstrap and a bit of zingy ginger.

name: Bees Knees
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'American Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Syrup / Mix'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients vigorously in a cocktail shaker for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass and garnish with a twist of lemon.

To fashion yourself some honey syrup, we suggest adding 1-part water to 1-part honey (clover honey if you have it) and stir them to dilute. If your honey is very thick or hard, heat your water first to help soften the honey in the mix. Or, just buy a bottle of pre-made honey mix.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Lemon Centric flavor profile, muted honey sweetness with gin botanicals.

name: Chartreuse Martini
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Green Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dry Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds and strain into a chilled nick & nora glass or martini glass.
source unknown
notes: Herbal with muted anise flavor, lightly dry vermouth finish

name: Chicago South Side
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '7', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Mint Leaves'}]

name: Clover Club

name: Cynar Negroni
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cynar'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice, stir for 30 seconds and strain into an old fashioned glass (chilled or with ice). Orange twist garnish.

name: East India Gimlet
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Celery bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'Dill'}]
recipe:
Add ice and water to a coupe glass to chill and set aside. Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake aggressively for 15 seconds. Dump water/ice from coupe and pour contents from your shaker into the coupe glass.

Garnish with a sprig of dill and serve.
Carl Brown, Permit Room at Dishoom King’s Cross

name: French 75
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Champagne / Sparkling Wine'}]

name: Gin & Jam

recipe:

name: Gin & Orange Special

recipe:
Add all ingredients over ice into a tall glass and serve. Simple! The key to the flavors of this cocktail is the use of fresh pressed orange juice, it just doesn't compare to bottled OJ.

name: Hotel Nacional
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apricot Brandy'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds aggressively (to build a nice pineapple foam). Strain into a chilled coupe glass and serve.

Alternatively this works great with a dark rum.

notes: A bold rum flavor balanced against tropical pineapple and apricot, a floral slightly delicate sour

name: Mojito
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'barspoons', 'name': 'Casters sugar (superfine sugar)'}, {'amount': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Mint Leaves'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Club Soda'}]
recipe:
Add your lime wedges and sugar to your tall glass, and muddle them together. Slap ('spank') your mint and add it into your glass over your muddled lime and sugar. Give it a gentle muddle without tearing your mint.

Add crushed ice over the ingredients until you're about halfway up the glass. Then top with light rum and integrate the ingredients by stirring with a bar spoon.

Top with additional crushed ice and top with club soda. Add your garnish and a straw and serve.
source unknown
notes: Light and refreshing sweet mint and sour lime bite with a light rum backend flavor.

name: Nacional Daiquiri
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apricot Brandy'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Peach Bitters'}]
recipe:

Hotel Nacional, Havana Cuba
notes: Warm rum and citrus with a hint of peach in the finish; great balance of sweet against sour.

name: Passion Fruit Daiquiri
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}]
recipe:
Build all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds, strain into your coupe glass and serve.

name: Añejo Old Fashioned
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Anejo Tequila'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Agave nectar'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Orange peel'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Luxardo Maraschino Cherry'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Bittercube Chipotle Cacao Bitters'}]

name: Margarita
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Tequila'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Agave nectar'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orange Liqueur'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into your cocktail shaker with ice. Shake for 15 seconds and strain over ice into an old fashioned glass and garnish. Optionally, rim your glass with salt.

For a slightly sweeter experience, utilize crushed ice to chill down the cocktail faster and colder. For a more sour experience, tailer back your agave nectar by a quarter ounce (or 7.5ml).

notes: Agave forward flavor, mingled with citrus and bright tequila notes.

name: Matador
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Tequila'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over fresh ice into a highball glass and serve.

name: Paloma

recipe:

More advanced / tequila lovers may reduce the grapefruit soda ratio to 4 ounces (120ml) to bring out more tequila notes.

name: The Batanga
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Tequila'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': 'null', 'unit': 'null', 'name': 'Coca Cola'}]
recipe:
Build in a highball / collins glass, add ice and follow it with lime juice, tequila and top with Coca Cola. We prefer Mexican Coca Cola as it does not contain super sweet high fructose corn syrup.

If the acidity is too high, dial back your lime juice to a quarter ounce (or just a lime quarter squeeze and drop in).

name: Vampiro

recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over fresh ice into an old fashioned glass.

The original design was a combination of tequila and a homemade sangrita, however the use of orange juice with tomato juice and spices in this cocktail recipe bring those together in the build itself.

For hot sauce, one may choose Cholula as it is a Mexican hot sauce or something spicier.

name: Caipiroska / Capivodka

recipe:
Put lime quarters in the bottom of an Old Fashioned glass and add sugar over the lime quarters. Muddle the lime with the sugar using a muddler as this will score the lime skin against the sugar grains and extract additional oils from the skin.

Once the limes are crushed into the sugar grains, fill the glass three quarters full with crushed ice then fill with vodka and give it a stir.

name: Cosmopolitan

name: Espresso Vodka Martini
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee Liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh Brewed Coffee / Espresso'}]
recipe:

name: Greyhound

recipe:
Build over ice in a tall glass and serve. If there is extra room in the glass, you can always double the ratio to fill out the glass.

Prior to 1945, in the United States at least, most cocktails contained gin instead of vodka so many classics like the Greyhound were gin-based utilizing similar ratios.

name: Harvey Wallbanger

name: Kamikaze

name: Lemon Drop
