recipe:
Build over ice in an old fashioned glass, adding your cream/milk/half-and-half last so it builds a neat presentation. Optionally, add nutmeg to the top as a garnish.

Some folks opt to shake and strain this beverage, which works perfectly fine as well. You may also opt to swap Half & Half for cream for a thicker consistency or milk for a thinner consistency.
source unknown
notes: Classic coffee cream flavor with muted vodka notes, reduced by the overall fat content.

name: Woo Woo
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Peach Schnapps'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cranberry Juice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass or Martini Glass and serve.

Optionally, for a “tall drink”, double the recipe and build it over ice in a Hi-Ball Glass or Collins Glass.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Peach-forward flavor with a tart finish of cranberry, ethanol hides well.

name: Bashful Canadian
ingredients: [{'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aperol'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maple Syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake aggressively for 15 seconds. Strain contents into a chilled coupe glass or Nick & Nora glass and serve.

We suggest a high proof rye for this cocktail, like 100 Proof Knob Creek.
Common Man Cocktails
notes: A lightly sweet balance of maple against a potent punch of rye and a light lingering bitter finish.

name: Boulevardier
ingredients: [{'amount': '37.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Campari'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Chill your old fashioned glass with ice and water and set aside. Add all ingredients with ice to a mixing glass and stir for 2 minutes. Dump your chilled water from the old fashioned glass and strain into chilled glass.

Rub an orange twist around the rim of the glass and drop into the glass. Serve.
Harry MacElhone / Harry's New York Bar
notes: Slightly sweeter than a negroni that brings the rye intensity followed by a campari bitter bite that lingers.

name: Bourbon Alexander
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Creme de Cacao'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Half and Half / Cream'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Salt'}]
recipe:
Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker without ice and dry shake aggressively for 20 seconds. Add ice into your shaker and shake until chilled for about 15 seconds. Strain contents into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with nutmeg.
Monica Wolf
notes: Creamy chocolate with a kick of bourbon to warm the heart.

name: Emerald Cocktail
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Irish Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled (usually around 2 minutes). Strain into a chilled coupe glass. Using an orange zest, twist zest to extract oils over drink and rub it along the rim of your glass and drop into the drink.

We received a bit of our bitterness in the taste profile from our use of Carpano Antica Vermouth--while this drink doesn't call for it specifically it brings interesting flavor to the design.
source unknown
notes: Lots of orange/citrus notes with a hint bitterness and sweet with a light fortified wine, but very little aggressive whiskey-forward flavor.

name: Gold Rush
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Syrup / Mix'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake with ice for 15 seconds. Strain over fresh ice into an old fashioned glass.
T. J. Siegel, Milk & Honey, New York City
notes: The sweet and sour combination that feels like a whiskey sour but with a richer sweetness of honey. Great with high proof bourbon.

name: Greenpoint
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Yellow Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled, usually around 2 minute. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a lemon twist.
Milk & Honey NYC
notes: Nice smooth rye flavor with a nuanced herbal sweetness and only a mild / slight vermouth finish.

name: Hot Toddy
ingredients: [{'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Bourbon'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '180.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Boiling Water'}]
recipe:
Prepare your mug by adding additional boiling water to your mug to warm it up quickly. Once warm/hot empty your mug and add lemon juice, honey bourbon (or regular bourbon) and top with hot water.

To prepare a studded lemon peel, cut your peel and poke 3 whole cloves through the peel and add it to your drink. Add a cinnamon stick and serve.

If you do not have honey bourbon we suggest your favorite bourbon and, if you desire honey, add a bar spoon of honey to your finished drink and stir (helps to remove it from the spoon as well).
Common Man Cocktails
garnish: Studded Lemon Peel and Cinnamon Stick
notes: Warm citrus, alcohol (especially from the hot fumes) and honey, just as one would expect.

name: Irish Coffee
ingredients: [{'amount': '240.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Brown Sugar'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Irish Whiskey'}]
recipe:
Fill mug with hot water to preheat it, then empty. Pour hot coffee into the warm glass to about 3/4 full and then stir in brown sugar until dissolved. Add your Irish Whiskey of choice, and top with whipped cream. Serve hot.
source unknown
notes: Coffee, with a mild irish whiskey, with a modest bitterness

name: Kentucky Chocolate
ingredients: [{'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Demerara Simple Syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sour mix'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Chocolate Bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}]
recipe:
Add all all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and dry shake (no ice) for 20 seconds aggressively. Add ice to the shaker and shake again for 15 seconds and strain over ice into an old fashioned glass.

Optionally garnish with a lemon wheel.

Works fantastic with a higher proof bourbon, we typically build with Elijah Craig Bourbon.
Jennifer Schommer
notes: A creamy, silky texture with oak, vanilla and with a good deal of dark chocolate flavor; a chocolate whiskey sour of sorts.

name: Manhattan
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass halfway filled with ice. Stir until well-chilled and strain into a chilled coupe or martini glass. Garnish with a cherry.
source unknown
notes: Mild sweetness with a musky rye flavor and a hint of fortified wine

name: Nor'Easter
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maple Syrup'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Beer'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients except ginger beer with ice into a cocktail shaker and shake until extremely cold (probably 20 seconds), pour into a chilled coupe glass and top with ginger beer. Garnish and serve.
source unknown
notes: Lightly sweet maple bourbon, a zing of ginger and a warming feeling.

name: Old Fashioned
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Sugar Cube'}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Luxardo Maraschino Cherry'}]
recipe:
Add sugar cube to an old fashioned glass and soak it with bitters of your choice (we prefer Boy Drinks World Walnut Bitters but you can use Angostura as well).

Once you've added your bitters to the sugar, muddle the sugar cube into the glass with a muddler and then pour your rye (or bourbon) into the glass. Add a couple cubes of ice and stir to dilute ice down a bit and integrate the bitter sugars.

Optionally, garnish with an orange wheel and maraschino cherry.
source unknown
notes: Forward rye flavor with muted bitters; simple.

name: Rattlesnake
ingredients: [{'amount': '52.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Demerara Simple Syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Egg White'}]
recipe:
Add ingredients to a shaker tin with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled lowball glass or 8 oz coupe glass and serve. When working with egg whites, use the dry shake method (shake all ingredients without ice aggressively for 20-seconds then add ice and shake for 15 seconds).
Will Elliott, Maison Premiere, New York City
notes: Rye whiskey spice, black licorice with an off-dry finish.

name: Revolver
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee Liqueur'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}]
recipe:
Build all ingredients in a mixing glass and stir for about 2 minutes (or until sufficiently chilled) and strain into a chilled nick & nora glass. This drink needs the dilution and chill down time, don't skimp on the stir.
Jon Santer
notes: Spirit forward, coffee with a blast of rye whiskey right up in your face.

name: Sazerac
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Sugar Cube'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': "Peychaud's Bitters"}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}]
recipe:
Add absinthe to your chilled old fashioned glass, and move it around the base of the glass and along the sides (known as a "rinse") and pour the remaining out. Set glass aside.

Muddle sugar and bitters in a mixing glass and then add rye whiskey. Add ice and stir to chill down for about 2 minutes. Strain into rinsed old fashioned glass; use lemon twist to express oils over drink and on glass. Discard lemon twist.

Note: It's not a mistake, a sazerac isn't served on ice. Just a chilled old fashioned glass.
Antoine Amedie Peychaud
notes: Spicy rye with a backend hint of anise/fennel and a slight sweetness.

name: The Godfather
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Amaretto'}]
recipe:
Fill a mixing glass with ice, add ingredients and stir for about two minutes. Strain into a rocks glass, ice is optional.
source unknown
notes: Bourbon forward vanilla's and oaks with a hint of cherry and light sweetness

name: Whiskey Smash
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Mint Leaves'}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Lemon Wedges'}]
recipe:
Cut a half lemon into wedges. In a shaker, muddle the lemon with the simple syrup. Add mint leave and perform a more gentle muddle. Add the remaining ingredients with ice and shake. Dump ice and ingredients into a double old fashioned and add more ice as necessary.
source unknown
notes: Warm buttery oak, citrus, mint, light touch of vanilla notes in the finish. Whiskey brand dictates profile.

name: 5th Amendment
ingredients: [{'amount': '52.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Yellow Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fernet Branca'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Falernum Syrup'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Passion Fruit Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and stir until chilled (usually about 2 minutes). Strain over fresh ice into an old fashioned glass. Rub a lemon peel around the edges of the glass and drop into the drink. Serve.

Note: You can use Velvet Falernum or Falernum Syrup for this recipe.
source unknown
notes: Herbal flavors of eucalyptus, fennel, a bit of citrus that's not too alcohol-forward; not too unlike a sweeter sazerac.

name: Bijou Cocktail
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Green Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Add ice to your Nick and Nora glass (our coupe/martini) with water and set aside. Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir for around two minutes. Dump cold water out of your glass and strain cocktail into your now chilled vessel.

Garnish with an olive or real maraschino cherry and serve.

Note: We have chose Harry Johnson's original recipe over Dale Degroffs re-balance because of the stronger chartreuse flavor profile without the lighter "watered down" feel of the additional gin.
1900 Harry Johnson's Bartenders Manual
notes: A bright chartreuse and and gin vibrancy with a good deal of potency. A balance of botanicals and herbs.

name: Chartreuse Martini
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Green Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dry Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds and strain into a chilled nick & nora glass or martini glass.
source unknown
notes: Herbal with muted anise flavor, lightly dry vermouth finish

name: Corpse Reviver #2
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cointreau'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Lillet Blanc'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}]
recipe:
Add absinthe to chilled coupe and swirl it around the glass and discard remaining absinthe (known as a "rinse"). Build remaining ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into chilled coupe and serve.
source unknown
notes: An herbal sour bite that will wake you up with a bit of aromatic gin/juniper aroma with a bit of a fennel mid-palate flavor.

name: Davy Jones's Locker
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gold Jamaican Rum'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fernet Branca'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cinnamon syrup'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds, strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass and garnish with a lime.
Brad Farran
notes: Dry citrus start, herbal eucalyptus finish, a bit potent

name: East India Gimlet
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Celery bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'Dill'}]
recipe:
Add ice and water to a coupe glass to chill and set aside. Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake aggressively for 15 seconds. Dump water/ice from coupe and pour contents from your shaker into the coupe glass.

Garnish with a sprig of dill and serve.
Carl Brown, Permit Room at Dishoom King’s Cross
notes: Herbal dill, mild sour and floral gin components mingled together in a symphony of flavor

name: Ginger's Lost Island
ingredients: [{'amount': '37.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '37.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Liqueur'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apple Juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Agave nectar'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Cardamom Pods'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Cinnamon'}]
recipe:
Add cardamom pods to a cocktail shaker and lightly muddle/crush the pods. Add ice and the remaining ingredients into your shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Double strain over ice into a double old fashioned glass.
Bryan Dayton
notes: light mezcal start with a ginger mid-palate and a light eucalyptus and smoke finish. A bit herbal/medicinal.

name: Hanky Panky
ingredients: [{'amount': '52.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '52.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Fernet Branca'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled (usually up to 2 minutes). Strain into a chilled martini glass, add an orange twist, and serve.
Ada Coleman
notes: A smooth sweetness, brown sugar that moves into Eucalypus, citrus with forward-vermouth finish. Very manhattan like in flavor design.

name: Jagerita
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Jagermeister'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Agave nectar'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orange Liqueur'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and stir for a minute, strain over fresh ice into an old fashioned.
source unknown
notes: Herbal notes, jagermeister bitter and fennel flavor like a medicinal margarita.

name: Last of the Oaxacans
ingredients: [{'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Green Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}]
recipe:
Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake well for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe or Nick & Nora glass and serve!
Serious Eats
notes: A smokey start, mild sour with a herbal finish

name: Norwegian Wood
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aquavit'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apple Brandy'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Yellow Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir for 30 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail / coupe glass and garnish with a lemon peel.
Jeffrey Morgenthaler
notes: Moderately bitter, mildly herbal, and dry finish

name: Sin Cyn
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Single Malt Scotch (12 Year)'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cynar'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Carpano Antica Sweet Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and stir until chilled (roughly 2 minutes is usually best). Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with an orange twist. Serve.
Red Owl Tavern in Philadelphia
notes: A light bitter orange start, light eucalyptus herbal note, with a mild well-balanced scotch against the herbaceousness

name: Social Season
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aperol'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Yellow Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake it for 12 seconds, strain it over crushed ice, then add a bit of crushed ice on the top.
Boston Tiki Party
notes: A light bitter aperol, a flavorful sweet passion fruit, light tart, lots of flavors going on

name: The Last Word
ingredients: [{'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Green Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe or nick & nora glass.
Rediscovered by Murray Stenson, Zig Zag Cafe
notes: A balanced herbal forward cocktail that doesn't lean towards sour, and has hints of sweetness.

name: Hot Peppermint Patty
ingredients: [{'amount': '37.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Creme de Cacao'}, {'amount': '37.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Green Creme de Menthe'}, {'amount': '37.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Peppermint schnapps'}, {'amount': '150.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Hot Chocolate'}]
recipe:
Warm up a coffee mug with hot water and set aside until ready. Drain hot water and add all alcohol ingredients and top with hot chocolate and serve.
source unknown
notes: It's like you ate an Andes Candies, warm chocolate with a blast of peppermint

name: Hot Toddy
ingredients: [{'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Bourbon'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '180.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Boiling Water'}]
recipe:
Prepare your mug by adding additional boiling water to your mug to warm it up quickly. Once warm/hot empty your mug and add lemon juice, honey bourbon (or regular bourbon) and top with hot water.

To prepare a studded lemon peel, cut your peel and poke 3 whole cloves through the peel and add it to your drink. Add a cinnamon stick and serve.

If you do not have honey bourbon we suggest your favorite bourbon and, if you desire honey, add a bar spoon of honey to your finished drink and stir (helps to remove it from the spoon as well).
Common Man Cocktails
garnish: Studded Lemon Peel and Cinnamon Stick
notes: Warm citrus, alcohol (especially from the hot fumes) and honey, just as one would expect.

name: Irish Coffee
ingredients: [{'amount': '240.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Brown Sugar'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Irish Whiskey'}]
recipe:
Fill mug with hot water to preheat it, then empty. Pour hot coffee into the warm glass to about 3/4 full and then stir in brown sugar until dissolved. Add your Irish Whiskey of choice, and top with whipped cream. Serve hot.
source unknown
notes: Coffee, with a mild irish whiskey, with a modest bitterness

name: Spanish Coffee
ingredients: [{'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Overproof Rum / 151'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Triple sec'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee Liqueur'}, {'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Hot Coffee'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Whipped Cream'}]
recipe:
Rim mug with a thick later of sugar using lime juice or water to stick sugar to the rim (inside and out.) Once the sugar is stuck and slightly solidified add 151 to your mug along side orange liqueur / triple sec.

Now, light your liquid on fire and tip your mug carefully so it begins to caramelize the sugars along the inside of the rim. Continue to roll along the sides so the flame licks the sugar rim and warms it.

Add a few dashes of nutmeg (so it lights up and sparks). Add kahlua, which will put out the fire (or, put it out on your own if it doesn't go out.) Then top with coffee. Float whipped cream on top.
Jeffery Morgenthaler
notes: Warm dark roast coffee with a balanced sweetness and a punch of ethanol on the tongue.

name: 3 Mile Long Island Iced Tea
ingredients: [{'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Triple sec'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sour mix'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coca Cola'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Bittercube Blackstrap Bitters'}]
recipe:
Fill your tall glass with ice cubes and add gin, rum, triple sec and vodka. Top sour mix and coca-cola; add two dashes of blackstrap bitters and garnish with a lemon wedge.

Our original recipe for the 3 mile long island used Great in 28 bitters, which do not exist anymore. We've revised this slightly from our original recipe use.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Drawing potency of spirits combined, with a bit more mild sweetness.

name: Long Island Iced Tea
ingredients: [{'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Tequila'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Triple sec'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sour mix'}, {'amount': 'null', 'unit': 'null', 'name': 'Coca Cola'}]
recipe:
Fill a highball glass with ice and add all ingredients except coca-cola. Top with coke, best when Mexican (sugar cane) based coca-cola is used. If you do not have sour mix available, you can use equal parts sugar and fresh lemon juice.
source unknown
notes: Powerful and potent with a bit of a citrus tea flavor

name: Amaro Manhattan
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bully Boy Amaro'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Luxardo Maraschino Cherry Syrup'}]
recipe:
Add ingredients to stirring glass with ice and stir for 30 seconds to 1 minute until well chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and optionally add a Luxardo Maraschino Cherry. Adding the cherry juice to your stir is also optional, if you're looking for a bit of added sweetness.

notes: Bright bourbon flavor, mild sweetness with a slight bitter finish

name: Bensonhurst
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dry Vermouth'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'barspoons', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Cynar'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and stir for about 2 minutes. Strain into a chilled glass and serve.

name: Boulevardier
ingredients: [{'amount': '37.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Campari'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Chill your old fashioned glass with ice and water and set aside. Add all ingredients with ice to a mixing glass and stir for 2 minutes. Dump your chilled water from the old fashioned glass and strain into chilled glass.

Rub an orange twist around the rim of the glass and drop into the glass. Serve.
Harry MacElhone / Harry's New York Bar
notes: Slightly sweeter than a negroni that brings the rye intensity followed by a campari bitter bite that lingers.

name: Brooklyn
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dry Vermouth'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and stir for up to 2 minutes until well chilled. Strain into a chilled martini glass, coupe or nick & nora and serve.

The original recipe calls for Amer Picon or angostura bitters, but the most reasonable substitution is orange bitters because it is widely available.
source unknown
notes: A dry forward flavor with a subtle rye to add a mild sweetness, the maraschino liqueur is quite muted but ties the flavors together.

name: Civil War
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cocchi Sweet Vermouth di Torino'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cynar'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Fee Brothers Old Fashioned Bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Luxardo Maraschino Cherry'}]
recipe:
Build in a mixing glass and stir for 2 minutes, strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a luxardo maraschino cherry and serve.
Driftwood Room
notes: A smokey and spicy version of the manhattan with a bit of additional bitterness.

name: Emerald Cocktail
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Irish Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled (usually around 2 minutes). Strain into a chilled coupe glass. Using an orange zest, twist zest to extract oils over drink and rub it along the rim of your glass and drop into the drink.

We received a bit of our bitterness in the taste profile from our use of Carpano Antica Vermouth--while this drink doesn't call for it specifically it brings interesting flavor to the design.
source unknown
notes: Lots of orange/citrus notes with a hint bitterness and sweet with a light fortified wine, but very little aggressive whiskey-forward flavor.

name: Greenpoint
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Yellow Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled, usually around 2 minute. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a lemon twist.
Milk & Honey NYC
notes: Nice smooth rye flavor with a nuanced herbal sweetness and only a mild / slight vermouth finish.

name: Hanky Panky
ingredients: [{'amount': '52.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '52.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Fernet Branca'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled (usually up to 2 minutes). Strain into a chilled martini glass, add an orange twist, and serve.

notes: A smooth sweetness, brown sugar that moves into Eucalypus, citrus with forward-vermouth finish. Very manhattan like in flavor design.

name: Manhattan

ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Benedictine'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:

name: Remember the Maine
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'barspoons', 'name': 'Cherry Heering Liqueur'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Luxardo Maraschino Cherry'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and stir until chilled (or two minutes). Strain into a chilled coupe/martini glass and garnish with maraschino cherries.
Charles H. Baker

name: Rob Roy
ingredients: [{'amount': '75.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Scotch'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Luxardo Maraschino Cherry'}]

name: Grapefruit & Chilli Margarita
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Tequila'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Chili simple syrup'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and serve.

To make your own homemade chili simple syrup (although not as spicy) you can add use:
8 oz demerara sugar
4 oz. water
1 sliced jalepano
Heat to make simple syrup, then add slices of pepper & simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and steep 20 minutes. Strain and chill. Add vodka to keep stable.
telegraph.co.uk
notes: Tequila forward agave, fresh tart grapefruit with a pepper heat that builds sip over sip.

name: Margarita
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Tequila'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Agave nectar'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orange Liqueur'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into your cocktail shaker with ice. Shake for 15 seconds and strain over ice into an old fashioned glass and garnish. Optionally, rim your glass with salt.

For a slightly sweeter experience, utilize crushed ice to chill down the cocktail faster and colder. For a more sour experience, tailer back your agave nectar by a quarter ounce (or 7.5ml).
Common Man Cocktails
notes: Agave forward flavor, mingled with citrus and bright tequila notes.

name: Pink Cadillac Margarita

name: Tequila Sour

name: Winter Margarita
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Reposado Tequila'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Egg White'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'Salt'}]

name: Cape Codder
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '135.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cranberry Juice'}]

name: Gin & Tonic
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '150.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Tonic Water'}]

name: Greyhound
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}]
recipe:
Build over ice in a tall glass and serve. If there is extra room in the glass, you can always double the ratio to fill out the glass.

Prior to 1945, in the United States at least, most cocktails contained gin instead of vodka so many classics like the Greyhound were gin-based utilizing similar ratios.

notes: A tart grapefruit flavor profile with mild potency hidden well in the juice.

name: Salty Dog

name: The Batanga

recipe:
Build in a highball / collins glass, add ice and follow it with lime juice, tequila and top with Coca Cola. We prefer Mexican Coca Cola as it does not contain super sweet high fructose corn syrup.

If the acidity is too high, dial back your lime juice to a quarter ounce (or just a lime quarter squeeze and drop in).
Don Javier Delgado
notes: Lightly sweet soda, a healthy bite of lime acidity, bright tequila with muted saline notes.

recipe:

Note: You can use Velvet Falernum or Falernum Syrup for this recipe.

recipe:

Add all your ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a paper plane.
Amaro Nonino
notes: a rollercoaster ride of flavor, a sweet start, a grapefruit mid-plate with a bitter bite that focuses on aperol and amaro nonino with little bourbon and an off-dry finish.

name: Penicillin
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Blended Scotch Whisky'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Syrup / Mix'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Islay single-malt Scotch Whisky'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Ginger Pieces'}]
recipe:
Muddle fresh ginger in a cocktail shaker and add the remaining ingredients (except the Islay Scotch Whisky) and shake with ice for 15 seconds. Double strain with a tea strainer over ice into your glass. Top with single malt Islay Scotch and garnish with candied ginger.
source unknown
notes: Not overly smoky considering the topping of Islay Scotch leaving a honey, citrus scotch profile.

name: Pusser's Painkiller ™
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': "Pusser's Rum"}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coco Lopez - Cream of Coconut'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over fresh ice into an old fashioned glass and garnish with a liberal amount of nutmeg.
Daphne Henderson
notes: Smooth mouthfeel like that of a blended drink, with coconut dominating, rum on the back end and a lovely nutmeg aromatic, on the sweeter side. Not too unlike a pina colada.

name: Revolver
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee Liqueur'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}]
recipe:
Build all ingredients in a mixing glass and stir for about 2 minutes (or until sufficiently chilled) and strain into a chilled nick & nora glass. This drink needs the dilution and chill down time, don't skimp on the stir.
Jon Santer
notes: Spirit forward, coffee with a blast of rye whiskey right up in your face.

name: Rum Runner
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Chambord / Raspberry Liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Banana liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'splash', 'name': 'Grenadine'}]
recipe:
Add everything into a cocktail shaker and shake it all for 10 to 15 seconds and strain into a tall glass. Garnish with an orange wheel.
source unknown
notes: Raspberry candy with a little banana filling; This is a potent number, you can taste the alcohol.

name: Rye Tai
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '10', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake with ice for 15 seconds, strain into an ice filled old fashioned glass and serve. If you want to add some garnish flare, hold your bitters out of the recipe until the end and dash them all on top of the drink to give a white/dark contrasting look!
Nick Brown, The Spaniard, New York City
notes: Almond, cinnamon, trade spices and a finish of lightly sweet rye whiskey

name: Stone Wall
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Ginger Pieces'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apple Cider'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Beer'}]
recipe:
Muddle simple syrup with ginger in a cocktail tin and then add rum, cider and ice. Top your shaker and shake for 15 seconds, double strain the contents into an ice filled rocks glass. Garnish and serve.
Dale Degroff
notes: A zing of ginger with a nice apple flavor profile with just a hint of rum character.

name: Tequila Sunrise
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Blanco Tequila'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Grenadine'}]
recipe:
Add ice to a highball glass and add tequila and orange juice. Sink grenadine to the bottom by slowly pouring it into the drink.
source unknown
notes: Citrus and agave with a light sweetness, works great with all style of tequila especially Reposado tequila.

name: Trinidad Sour
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}]
recipe:
Chill a large coupe glass with water and ice; set aside.

Add cocktail ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Dump ice and water from your glass and strain contents of the shaker into your chilled glass.

If you fall in love with a Trinidad sour, we suggest a 16 oz bottle of angostura bitters as you'll be going through bitters quickly.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Bitter clove, allspice, nutmeg and other trade spices with just the right amount of balance

name: Air Mail
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Syrup / Mix'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': 'null', 'unit': 'null', 'name': 'Champagne / Sparkling Wine'}]
recipe:
Build all ingredients except champagne in a cocktail shaker with ice, give it a healthy 10 second shake. Strain into a coupe or Nick & Nora glass and top with champagne (at least 1.5 oz). Historically garnished with a postage stamp, probably can be skipped for this one. If possible, use a light cuban rum.
source unknown
notes: Sweet flavors of rum and honey with a hint of champagne

name: Alabama Slammer
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Southern Comfort'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sloe Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Amaretto'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over fresh ice into a highball and serve.
source unknown
notes: Tropical sweetness of brown sugar and citrus balanced like an "alcoholic tang." Amaretto and orange juice combination is always a great killer flavor profile.

name: Amaretto Sour
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Amaretto'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Egg White'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Luxardo Maraschino Cherry'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into your cocktail shaker. Because we're using egg white, dry shake (with no ice) the cocktail aggressively for 20 seconds. Add ice cubes and shake for an additional 15 seconds and strain over ice. Garnish and serve!

Jeffrey Morgenthaler suggests cask strength bourbon (higher proof stuff), it's definitely a great way to cut through all the flavor and give you bourbon intensity.
Jeffrey Morgenthaler
notes: Beautiful almond and oak flavor with an off-dry finish that lingers with amaretto.

name: Amaro Manhattan
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bully Boy Amaro'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Luxardo Maraschino Cherry Syrup'}]
recipe:
Add ingredients to stirring glass with ice and stir for 30 seconds to 1 minute until well chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and optionally add a Luxardo Maraschino Cherry. Adding the cherry juice to your stir is also optional, if you're looking for a bit of added sweetness.
source unknown
notes: Bright bourbon flavor, mild sweetness with a slight bitter finish

name: Ankle Breaker
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cherry Heering Liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Overproof Rum / 151'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into your cocktail shaker, add crushed ice and shake for 10 seconds, dump contents into an old fashioned glass and serve.
Jeff Berry's REMIXED
notes: Well balanced rum and dark smokey cherry

name: Aperol Spritz
ingredients: [{'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Prosecco'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aperol'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Club Soda'}]
recipe:
Add ice to a wine / champagne glass and follow that up with Prosecco. Add Aperol and club soda and follow that up with your garnish and serve.
source unknown
notes: A slight citrus sweet light fruitiness balanced against a zesty soft bitter bite

name: Barmuda Triangle
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': "Gosling's Black Seal Rum"}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Amaretto'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and serve.
source unknown
notes: Dry and acidic, not too sweet, but all the flavors pair well together without anything overpowering; a bit of molasses/blackstrap, musty rye and hard to put down.

name: Chicago South Side
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '7', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Mint Leaves'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients vigorously in a cocktail shaker (including mint) for 10 seconds and double strain into a chilled coupe glass, garnish with 1 mint leaf.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Lovely aromatic flavor of trade spices, gin botanicals and acidity. Just a great drink.

name: Cynar Flip
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Canadian Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cynar'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cointreau'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Clove Simple Syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Bittertruth Jerry Thomas Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake aggressively for one minute and strain (or double strain) into a coupe glass.
source unknown
notes: Silky mouthfeel, lightly sweet, nice moderate bitterness

name: Daiquiri
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'Salt'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into your cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe glass or over ice into an old fashioned glass and enjoy. Optional garnish would include a lime twist.

We call for "rum", generically, because the daiquiri works with all your favorites from a light rum to an aged rum or even a Demerara rum.
Common Man Cocktails
notes: Refreshing sour bite with a lingering lime flavor with an overall backbone of beautiful rum.

name: Disaronno Wears Cavalli Sour
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Disaronno Originale Amaretto'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Prosecco'}, {'amount': '10', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add lemon juice, simple syrup and disaronno to a cocktail shaker and shake for 10 seconds. Strain into a champagne flute and top with Prosecco. Float 10 dashes of bitters on top and garnish.
Disaronno
notes: Sweet flavor of disaronno meets prosecco with a beautiful trade spice profile of bitters.

name: Drunken Pimento
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Spiced Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': "Don's Spice #2"}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Ale'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients except ginger ale to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over ice into an old fashioned glass and top with ginger ale. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Derrick and Jennifer Schommer
notes: Rich robust flavor, pronounced aged rum, brown sugar and allspice notes with a muted clove and vanilla.

name: East India Gimlet
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Celery bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'Dill'}]
recipe:
Add ice and water to a coupe glass to chill and set aside. Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake aggressively for 15 seconds. Dump water/ice from coupe and pour contents from your shaker into the coupe glass.

Garnish with a sprig of dill and serve.
Carl Brown, Permit Room at Dishoom King’s Cross
notes: Herbal dill, mild sour and floral gin components mingled together in a symphony of flavor

name: East Side
ingredients: [{'amount': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Mint Leaves'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Cucumber Slices'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': "Hendrick's Gin"}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Bittercube Trinity Bitters'}]
recipe:
Muddle cucumber in the bottom of your cocktail shaker along with simple syrup and mint. Add the remaining ingredients to the shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Double strain (with a tea strainer) into your glass and garnish with a mint leaf.

notes: Great cucumber flavor with mild mint structure with just enough gin botanicals to keep it complex yet fun.

name: Easy Pina Colada
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '37.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coconut Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vanilla Rum'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a martini / coupe glass and serve! Easy!
source unknown
notes: It tastes like a pina colada, flavorful rum, vanilla and pineapple all in your business.

name: Forbidden Sour
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'PAMA Pomegranate Liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into an old fashioned glass and add garnishes if desired.
source unknown
notes: Bourbon based notes with a lingering pomegranate sweet and tart

name: Golden Cadillac
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Galliano L Autentico'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'White Creme de Cacao'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Heavy Cream'}]
recipe:
Chill a cocktail glass or Nick & Nora glass with ice and water; leave sitting while you build the drink.

Add all ingredients to a shaker tin with ice; shake for 15 seconds. Dump ice and water from your glass and strain contents of the shaker into your chilled glass; add a dusting of cinnamon on top and serve.

Or, if you're really into it, use a blender on high!
Poor Red's
notes: Lots of creamy flavor, like a melted Hersey's Kiss or

name: Hemingway Daiquiri
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to an iced cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe/cocktail glass and serve.

Also been called Daiquiri #3.

notes: Light sour lime against herbal maraschino sweetness and a mild yet muted rum flavor. Easy to drink, good balance.

name: High Fashion Cocktail
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '37.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Elderflower Liqueur'}, {'amount': '37.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Rhubarb Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over ice into your glass and garnish.
source unknown

name: Hotel Nacional
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apricot Brandy'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds aggressively (to build a nice pineapple foam). Strain into a chilled coupe glass and serve.

Alternatively this works great with a dark rum.
source unknown
notes: A bold rum flavor balanced against tropical pineapple and apricot, a floral slightly delicate sour

name: Hurricane
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Rum'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Grenadine'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into an iced Hurricane Glass or Hi-Ball. Garnish and serve.
