notes: A flavorful fruit blend with a tart profile and a mild sour bite.

name: Java Tai
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Averna Amaro'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Black Coffee'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}]
recipe:
Brew strong coffee / espresso and let it cool. Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and "dry shake" (without ice) for 20 seconds aggressively. Add ice to your cocktail shaker and shake for an additional 15 seconds and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
source unknown
notes: Deliciously silky smooth coffee flavor, like a coffee milk with no alcohol taste.

name: Kentucky Chocolate
ingredients: [{'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Demerara Simple Syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sour mix'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Chocolate Bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}]
recipe:
Add all all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and dry shake (no ice) for 20 seconds aggressively. Add ice to the shaker and shake again for 15 seconds and strain over ice into an old fashioned glass.

Optionally garnish with a lemon wheel.

Works fantastic with a higher proof bourbon, we typically build with Elijah Craig Bourbon.
Jennifer Schommer
notes: A creamy, silky texture with oak, vanilla and with a good deal of dark chocolate flavor; a chocolate whiskey sour of sorts.

name: Kraken Hattan
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Kraken Black Spiced Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coconut Rum'}, {'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sour mix'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Luxardo Maraschino Cherry Syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients (except cherry syrup) into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe glass, and add cherry juice so it sinks to the bottom. Garnish and serve.
source unknown
notes: Sweet and sour cherry flavor with molasses and trade spices.

name: Lion's Tail
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Allspice dram / liqueur'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all your ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and give it a hardy shake for 15 seconds, strain into a coupe glass or nick and nora glass. Garnish with a slice of orange or other citrus.
The Café Royal Cocktail Book (1937)
notes: An off-dry flavor of bourbon, allspice finish that's well balanced with acidity.

name: Mai Tai
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Martinique Rhum / Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orange Curaçao'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to an iced cocktail shaker and shake for 10-15 seconds. Pour into your glass over crushed ice and garnish.

Note: No amber (aged) Martinique Rum & Dark Jamaican Rum? We suggest using a standard aged rum in the recipe as a substitution. So, instead of 1 oz / 30 ml of two rums, do 2 oz / 60 ml of your aged rum instead (Denizen Merchant's Reserve Rum is perfect for this recipe).
Trader Vic Bergeron via Beach Bum Berry Remixed
garnish: Sink hulled lime into drink; add mint sprig
notes: Lovely blend of rich flavorful rum, almond and mint with lingering citrus kick.

name: Manchester Cocktail
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cocktail & Sons Oleo Saccharum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Hella Bitters Citrus'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients in a cocktail shaker for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled Nick & Nora, garnish with a lime wheel and serve.
AwesomeDrinks.com
notes: Sweet and tart grapefruit, zesty citrus and lingering juniper notes; finishes dry and tart.

name: Margarita
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Tequila'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Agave nectar'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orange Liqueur'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into your cocktail shaker with ice. Shake for 15 seconds and strain over ice into an old fashioned glass and garnish. Optionally, rim your glass with salt.

For a slightly sweeter experience, utilize crushed ice to chill down the cocktail faster and colder. For a more sour experience, tailer back your agave nectar by a quarter ounce (or 7.5ml).
Common Man Cocktails
notes: Agave forward flavor, mingled with citrus and bright tequila notes.

name: Mojito
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'barspoons', 'name': 'Casters sugar (superfine sugar)'}, {'amount': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Mint Leaves'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Club Soda'}]
recipe:
Add your lime wedges and sugar to your tall glass, and muddle them together. Slap ('spank') your mint and add it into your glass over your muddled lime and sugar. Give it a gentle muddle without tearing your mint.

Add crushed ice over the ingredients until you're about halfway up the glass. Then top with light rum and integrate the ingredients by stirring with a bar spoon.

Top with additional crushed ice and top with club soda. Add your garnish and a straw and serve.
source unknown
notes: Light and refreshing sweet mint and sour lime bite with a light rum backend flavor.

name: Norwegian Wood
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aquavit'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apple Brandy'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Yellow Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir for 30 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail / coupe glass and garnish with a lemon peel.
Jeffrey Morgenthaler
notes: Moderately bitter, mildly herbal, and dry finish

name: Oaxacan Dead
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Reposado Tequila'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Falernum Syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cinnamon syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Chambord / Raspberry Liqueur'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}]
recipe:
Build in a tall glass and swizzle with crushed ice. Optionally, garnish with umbrella picked cherry and lime wheel.
source unknown
notes: Smokey Sweet Candy (aka "nana candy"); easy to drink, slightly unique flavor profile that's hard to pickup. Great smoky profile and sweeter flavors.

name: Pearl Harbor
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Midori Melon Liqueur'}, {'amount': '150.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Rhubarb Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add ice to a lowball or highball, then add vodka over the ice followed by midori liqueur. Top with the pinepple juice and either stir it (for it to taste great) or leave it layered (to look great).

Want to add a more interesting twist? Add Fee Brothers Rhubarb Bitters for a great spring time flare.
Common Man Cocktails
notes: Pineapple and melon flavor profile with a refreshing moderate sweetness

name: Planter's Punch
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Grenadine'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds and strain into a chilled coupe glass. Use your favorite dark rum for this recipe, we love Plantation Original Dark for this build.
source unknown
notes: Foamy Fruity flavors mingled with molasses forward dark rum with a juicy tropical loveliness.

name: Pusser's Painkiller ™
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': "Pusser's Rum"}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coco Lopez - Cream of Coconut'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over fresh ice into an old fashioned glass and garnish with a liberal amount of nutmeg.
Daphne Henderson
notes: Smooth mouthfeel like that of a blended drink, with coconut dominating, rum on the back end and a lovely nutmeg aromatic, on the sweeter side. Not too unlike a pina colada.

name: Rum Runner
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Chambord / Raspberry Liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Banana liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'splash', 'name': 'Grenadine'}]
recipe:
Add everything into a cocktail shaker and shake it all for 10 to 15 seconds and strain into a tall glass. Garnish with an orange wheel.
source unknown
notes: Raspberry candy with a little banana filling; This is a potent number, you can taste the alcohol.

name: Salty Dog
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'barspoons', 'name': 'Course Sea Salt'}]
recipe:
Rim a tall glass with salt and set aside. Shake gin and grapefruit juice vigorously in a cocktail shaker for 10 seconds and strain over ice into your tall rimmed glass. Garnish with a quarter slice of grapefruit and serve.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Light flavor of juniper and lightly tart fleshy grapefruit flavor.

name: Social Season
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aperol'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Yellow Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake it for 12 seconds, strain it over crushed ice, then add a bit of crushed ice on the top.
Boston Tiki Party
notes: A light bitter aperol, a flavorful sweet passion fruit, light tart, lots of flavors going on

name: Steve's Rum Barrel
ingredients: [{'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Syrup / Mix'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Jamaican rum'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Almond Extract'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to an immersion blender with crushed ice, dump into a tiki mug. For Pernod (Absinthe) do 6 drops (roughly 1 dash), for almond extract, do 3 drops (or around that, maybe a dash)
Jeff Berry's REMIXED
notes: A bit strong on potency, a mild bitter, not too sweet, not too sour, lots of tropical flavor with a light honey finish

name: Tequila Sour
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Reposado Tequila'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Agave nectar'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Bittercube Chipotle Cacao Bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Egg White'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker and dry shake (without ice) aggressively for 15 seconds. Add ice and shake again for 15 seconds then double strain into an old fashioned glass (ice optional). Add three dots of bitters for presentation and serve.
source unknown
notes: Lightly dry citrus meets agave with cinnamon spice, cacao and lingering tequila.

name: The Dorchester
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients vigorously in a cocktail shaker for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass or martini glass. Garnish with a grapefruit twist and serve.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Floral forward herbal flavor, mid-palate citrus acidity, finishing of juniper, sweet herbaceous linger.

name: The Vesper
ingredients: [{'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'London Dry Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vodka'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Lillet Blanc'}]
recipe:
Chill a large coupe glass with water and ice; set aside.

Add cocktail ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake aggressively for 10 seconds. Dump ice and water from your glass and double strain (to remove ice shards) contents of the shaker into your chilled glass.

Garnish with a lemon peel and serve.

If you can't find Lillet Blanc, you can substitute Cocchi Americano.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Strong and direct gin with a hint of bitter bite; not for the weak at heart.

name: The White Walker
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cinnamon syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake aggressively before dumping contents into a highball glass or pilsner class (if you make multiple batches). Top with crushed ice and garnish with your favorite tropical fruits and/or pineapple leaves.
Dan Rook, South Water Kitchen, Chicago
notes: Flavorful pineapple and light cinnamon notes playing off the quality of your rums

name: Trinidad Sour
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}]
recipe:
Chill a large coupe glass with water and ice; set aside.

Add cocktail ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Dump ice and water from your glass and strain contents of the shaker into your chilled glass.

If you fall in love with a Trinidad sour, we suggest a 16 oz bottle of angostura bitters as you'll be going through bitters quickly.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Bitter clove, allspice, nutmeg and other trade spices with just the right amount of balance

name: Whiskey Sour
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Egg White'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'Salt'}]
recipe:
Add ingredients to a shaker tin with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled lowball glass and serve. Egg White is optional (technically that makes it a Boston Sour, but it's a fantastic edition).

If using egg whites, use the dry shake method (shake all ingredients without ice aggressively for 20-seconds then add ice and shake for 15 seconds).
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: A mingling of citrus and whiskey and a silky smooth texture that ends off-dry.

name: Wise Oaxacan Mule
ingredients: [{'amount': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Ginger Pieces'}, {'amount': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Sage Leaves'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Syrup / Mix'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Beer'}]
recipe:
Muddle the honey, ginger, lemon and sage. Add whiskey and mezcal. Shake and strain with tea strainer into a cup filled with crushed ice. Top with the ginger beer and garnish with sage sprig.
Jennifer Schommer
notes: Smoky and oaky sage and refreshing chilled spicy ginger zing.

name: Age of Aquarius
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Syrup / Mix'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Campari'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients except Campari to your shaker tin with ice, and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over crushed ice into an old fashioned glass. Float Campari on top, roughly one-fifth of an ounce or around a bar spoon.
Devojka
notes: Starts sweet, moves to sour and tart with tail end of smokey and bitter yet mildly sweet.

name: Aztec Sacrifice
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Anejo Tequila'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Amaretto'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Beer'}, {'amount': '8', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Bittercube Chipotle Cacao Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients but ginger beer to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled nick and nora glass and top with ginger beer.
Common Man Cocktails
notes: A spicy ginger zing, a spicy bite of mole flavor and smooth tequila with a nice balance of sweet and tart, slight tiki tropic flavor.

name: Hurricane
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Rum'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Grenadine'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into an iced Hurricane Glass or Hi-Ball. Garnish and serve.
source unknown
notes: A flavorful fruit blend with a tart profile and a mild sour bite.

name: Luau
ingredients: [{'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Overproof Rum / 151'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add contents to a cocktail shaker with ice (or crushed ice) and shake aggressively for ten seconds. You can either pour over fresh crushed ice or dump right into your tiki mug. Serve!
To impress, garnish with orchids and citrus and an umbrella.
Gerry Corcoran
notes: Rich and tangy flavor, floral and full of flavors and a bit of finishing bite.

name: Passion Fruit Daiquiri
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}]
recipe:
Build all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds, strain into your coupe glass and serve.
Eric Scott
notes: Borders on the line of sour to super sour passion fruit tartness with lingering lime finish.

name: Pieces of Eight
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}]
recipe:
Build all ingredients in your cocktail shaker with crushed ice. Shake quickly for about five seconds and dump contents into a tall glass and garnish.
Beachbum Berry Remixed, A Gallery of Tiki Drinks
notes: Flavorful passion fruit balanced against sour citrus notes and a driving rum flavor. Delicious tropical appeal.

name: Port Light
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Grenadine'}, {'amount': '240.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ice'}]
recipe:
Build in blender with crushed ice, blend 5 seconds, dump into old fashioned glass and top with more crushed ice.
Beachbum Berry Remixed, A Gallery of Tiki Drinks
garnish: Garnish with bamboo pick with a bourbon cherry hanging off.
notes: flavorful and yummies

name: Social Season
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aperol'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Yellow Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake it for 12 seconds, strain it over crushed ice, then add a bit of crushed ice on the top.
Boston Tiki Party
notes: A light bitter aperol, a flavorful sweet passion fruit, light tart, lots of flavors going on

name: Apple Jack Cocktail
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apple Brandy'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orange Curaçao'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all the ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over fresh ice into an old fashioned glass and serve.
Dale Degroff, The Craft Cocktail
notes: Apple-forward flavor with a strong punch in the back, a lingering bitter and a very unsweet finish; granny smith apple-like

name: Bashful Canadian
ingredients: [{'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aperol'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maple Syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake aggressively for 15 seconds. Strain contents into a chilled coupe glass or Nick & Nora glass and serve.

We suggest a high proof rye for this cocktail, like 100 Proof Knob Creek.
Common Man Cocktails
notes: A lightly sweet balance of maple against a potent punch of rye and a light lingering bitter finish.

name: Chartreuse Martini
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Green Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dry Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds and strain into a chilled nick & nora glass or martini glass.
source unknown
notes: Herbal with muted anise flavor, lightly dry vermouth finish

name: Cynar Negroni
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cynar'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice, stir for 30 seconds and strain into an old fashioned glass (chilled or with ice). Orange twist garnish.
source unknown
notes: Plum, Fig, with a light sweetness and bitter finish

name: Fog Cutter
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Brandy / Cognac'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cream Sherry'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients but the Sherry into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Dump contents of shaker into a fog cutter glass (or tall highball) and float sherry on top. Garnish, straw, and serve.
Jeff Berry REMIXED
notes: Super sour with light sweet, and a vermouth-like sherry finish that may leave you shaking from the bite.

name: Oaxacan Jewel
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Green Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Carpano Antica Sweet Vermouth'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Mexican Mole Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir for about two minutes and strain (with a julep strainer) into a chilled coupe glass. Serve.
source unknown
notes: High potency with accents of herbs, black licorice, and a hint of smoke in the finish.

name: Scorpion Bowl
ingredients: [{'amount': '180.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '180.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Brandy / Cognac'}, {'amount': '240.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a blender/mixer and blend/mix for 10 seconds and dump all contents into a bowl (or a few glasses). Garnish with a gardenia (if you have one on hand).
Jeff Berry REMIXED
notes: A very generic "tiki drink", well balanced, good citrus to rum ratio that's not too sweet, not too dry. But, isn't memorable on complex flavors, good base for a new-aged tiki drink.

name: The Armande
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Jamaican rum'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Creme de Cacao'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Mexican Mole Bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'Salt'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients with ice to a mixing glass and stir for two minutes. Strain over fresh ice into an old fashioned glass and serve.

The recipe suggests an overproof (high proof) bourbon in making this cocktail.
Naomi Lesley
notes: A light chocolate hint against a nice whiskey flavor that leads to a spicy bite in the finish

name: Zombie (1934)
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gold Puerto Rican rum'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Jamaican rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Lemon Hart 151'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': "Don's Mix"}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Falernum Syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Grenadine'}, {'amount': '6', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a tin with crushed ice and pulse / blend for 5 seconds (we prefer the Hamilton Beach 730C Classic DrinkMaster Drink Mixer). Dump contents into a hi ball / collins glass and garnish with a mint sprig (and anything else you want)

This drink calls for roughly six ounces of crushed ice, but use your best judgement. More ice will dilute the drink down a bit, but that's a good thing for a zombie!
Jeff Berry REMIXED
notes: Potent explosion of rum, grapefruit, spices, molasses and muted dry anise finish.

name: Alaskan Duck Fart
ingredients: [{'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee Liqueur'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Irish Cream'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Canadian Whiskey'}]
recipe:
Pour coffee liqueur into the bottom of your shot glass and layer Irish cream on top. Weakly layer your Canadian whiskey over the Irish cream, it can mix/sink a bit into the Irish cream give the proper presentation.
Dave Schmidt
notes: A light burn from the Whiskey, a bit of a "mudslide" taste profile (coffee/chocolate/cream), slightly sweet

name: 5th & Adams
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Simple Syrup'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': "Peychaud's Bitters"}]
recipe:
All add ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds, strain into a chilled coupe glass. Or, double/triple the recipe and put it into a highball glass (because it's just too tasty not to do this).
Bestia: Italian Recipes Created in the Heart of L.A
notes: None

name: Blueberry Mezcal Margarita
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Orange Bitters'}, {'amount': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Blueberries'}]
recipe:
Puree or Muddle blueberries with fresh lime juice and simple syrup, combine in shaker with bitters and mezcal and shake for 8 to 10 seconds. Dump directly into your old fashioned glass and serve.
source unknown
notes: A lightly sweet blueberry with a tart sour finish that lingers with smoke

name: Decepticon
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Old Tom Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled martini glass, garnish with lemon twist and serve.
source unknown
notes: A smokey citrus with undertone of maraschino liqueur

name: Division Bell
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aperol'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}]
recipe:

name: The Long Goodbye

name: Winter Margarita

name: Wise Oaxacan Mule
ingredients: [{'amount': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Ginger Pieces'}, {'amount': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Sage Leaves'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Syrup / Mix'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Beer'}]

name: Paloma

recipe:

To make your own homemade chili simple syrup (although not as spicy) you can add use:

Heat to make simple syrup, then add slices of pepper & simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and steep 20 minutes. Strain and chill. Add vodka to keep stable.

name: Gin Gin Mule

recipe:
Muddle simple syrup, lime juice, and 8 mint leaves in the bottom of your shaker tin. Add gin and top with ice, then shake for 15 seconds. Double strain (with tea strainer to remove any mint) over fresh ice in a tall glass. Top with ginger beer and garnish with a fresh new mint sprig. Server with a straw.

Add all ingredients to a shaker tin with ice; shake for 15 seconds. Dump ice and water from your glass and strain contents of the shaker into your chilled glass; add a dusting of cinnamon on top and serve.

name: Lemon Drop
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Citrus Vodka'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Fine Granulated Sugar'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients vigorously in a cocktail shaker for 20 seconds (to help integrate the sugar) and strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass or Martini Glass. Cut a lemon twist over the glass to add additional oils and drop twist into the glass.

Optionally you can omit the sugar from the drink and rim the glass, but this can create a sticky mess and not integrate as well into the drink.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Flavor profile closely resembling that of a lemon drop candy.

name: Midori Sour

recipe:
Add all ingredients except for your soda to a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into an old fashioned glass over ice. Top with lemon-lime soda and optionally garnish with a maraschino cherry.

Optionally, to 'craft' this cocktail up a bit more, use a half ounce (15ml) egg white to give it a nice white foam with an off-dry finish.
source unknown
notes: A sweet candy melon with a acidic sour finish with a light carbonation.

name: Mr. Bali Hai

Add all ingredients with crushed ice into a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Dump contents into a double old fashioned glass or, if you've got one, a Mr. Bali Hai Tiki Mug (vintage) and serve.

Note: If you don't own coffee brandy, use a coffee liqueur instead (which is much the same, but with a rum base).

name: 3 Dots and a Dash

recipe:
Combine everything into a blender and blend at high speed for about 5 seconds. Pour into a tall glass and garnish with 3 cherries and a pineapple spear (can also stick the a blade of the pineapple in there). The three cherries are your three "dots" and the spear is the "dash."

notes: Dry citrus start, herbal eucalyptus finish, a bit potent

name: Dead Bastard
ingredients: [{'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Brandy / Cognac'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Ale'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients except ginger beer to a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Slowly stir ginger beer into your cocktail shaker to integrate. Then dump entire contents of your cocktail shaker into a double old fashioned glass. Garnish with mint sprig and orange slice.
Jeff Berry REMIXED
notes: Light/muted combination of bourbon and spicy ginger that remains light and refreshing. Not as bourbon-flavored as the dying bastard recipe.

name: Demerara Dry Float
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Demerara Rum'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Overproof Rum / 151'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maraschino Liqueur'}, {'amount': '75.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients except the overproof rum together in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake aggressively for 15 seconds. Strain over ice into an old fashioned glass and carefully top (pour over the back of a spoon) with overproof rum.

We suggest an overproof dark rum such as LemonHart 151 for this drink; a clear overproof rum won't look as pretty.
Intoxica by Jeff Berry
notes: Sweet and Tart with a growing tangy bite that grows on you while also bringing a good sour citrus

name: Doctor Funk
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Grenadine'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Club Soda'}]
recipe:
Shake all ingredients except club soda with ice for 15 seconds. Dump shaker contents into pilsner glass, tiki mug or favorite drinking vessel. Top with club soda, add more ice if needed.
Intoxica by Jeff Berry
notes: Lemonade and Good & Plenty candy, a light and refreshing sour against black licorice

name: Drunken Pimento
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Spiced Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': "Don's Spice #2"}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Ale'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients except ginger ale to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over ice into an old fashioned glass and top with ginger ale. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Derrick and Jennifer Schommer
notes: Rich robust flavor, pronounced aged rum, brown sugar and allspice notes with a muted clove and vanilla.

name: Dying Bastard
ingredients: [{'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Brandy / Cognac'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Beer'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients except ginger beer to a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Slowly stir ginger beer into your cocktail shaker to integrate. Then dump entire contents of your cocktail shaker into a double old fashioned glass. Garnish with mint sprig and orange slice.
Jeff Berry REMIXED
notes: Great combination of bourbon and spicy ginger that remains light and refreshing while carrying a bit of alcohol.

name: Easy Pina Colada
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '37.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coconut Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vanilla Rum'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a martini / coupe glass and serve! Easy!
source unknown
notes: It tastes like a pina colada, flavorful rum, vanilla and pineapple all in your business.

name: Fog Cutter
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Brandy / Cognac'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cream Sherry'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients but the Sherry into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Dump contents of shaker into a fog cutter glass (or tall highball) and float sherry on top. Garnish, straw, and serve.
Jeff Berry REMIXED
notes: Super sour with light sweet, and a vermouth-like sherry finish that may leave you shaking from the bite.

name: Hawaiian Slammer
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Overproof Rum / 151'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Banana liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coconut Rum'}, {'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '90.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Grenadine'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake aggressively for 15 seconds, strain over ice into a tall hi-ball glass and add maraschino cherries on an umbrella. Serve.
source unknown
notes: Fruity, but also intense with flavorful coconut and banana, and a bit of a rum bite.

name: Hotel Nacional
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apricot Brandy'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds aggressively (to build a nice pineapple foam). Strain into a chilled coupe glass and serve.

Alternatively this works great with a dark rum.
source unknown
notes: A bold rum flavor balanced against tropical pineapple and apricot, a floral slightly delicate sour

name: Hurricane
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Rum'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Grenadine'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into an iced Hurricane Glass or Hi-Ball. Garnish and serve.
source unknown
notes: A flavorful fruit blend with a tart profile and a mild sour bite.

name: Java Tai
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Averna Amaro'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Black Coffee'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}]
recipe:
Brew strong coffee / espresso and let it cool. Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and "dry shake" (without ice) for 20 seconds aggressively. Add ice to your cocktail shaker and shake for an additional 15 seconds and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
source unknown
notes: Deliciously silky smooth coffee flavor, like a coffee milk with no alcohol taste.

name: Jungle Bird
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Campari'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Demerara Simple Syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over ice into an old fashioned glass. You can garnish with a pineapple wedge and pineapple leaf if you have them hanging around.
Aviary bar in Kuala Lumpur
notes: Tropical pineapple flavor that starts sweet with a bit of dry campari bitterness but some will find it arguably sweet.

name: Krakatoa
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apricot Brandy'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee Liqueur'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Falernum Syrup'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Use fresh ice, crushed ice or dump the old ice from your cocktail shaker into your highball glass and serve. Garnish with fresh fruit if you so desire. It's tiki, get crazy.
source unknown
notes: Coffee notes right up front, citrus to follow with mingling clove; a tropical coffee beverage with interesting flavors.

name: Los Zelda
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Lemon Hart 151'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apple Juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Bittercube Chipotle Cacao Bitters'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Saline / Salt'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe glass. You can use Aphrodite Bitters if you have them, or other bitters that bring some level of coffee and cocoa nibs.
source unknown
notes: A spicy smoky balanced cocktail of citrus, tropical flavor and mezcal without too much apple juice flavor--mainly just used to fill it out.

name: Luau
ingredients: [{'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Overproof Rum / 151'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add contents to a cocktail shaker with ice (or crushed ice) and shake aggressively for ten seconds. You can either pour over fresh crushed ice or dump right into your tiki mug. Serve!
To impress, garnish with orchids and citrus and an umbrella.
Gerry Corcoran
notes: Rich and tangy flavor, floral and full of flavors and a bit of finishing bite.

name: Mai Tai
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Martinique Rhum / Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orange Curaçao'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to an iced cocktail shaker and shake for 10-15 seconds. Pour into your glass over crushed ice and garnish.

Note: No amber (aged) Martinique Rum & Dark Jamaican Rum? We suggest using a standard aged rum in the recipe as a substitution. So, instead of 1 oz / 30 ml of two rums, do 2 oz / 60 ml of your aged rum instead (Denizen Merchant's Reserve Rum is perfect for this recipe).
Trader Vic Bergeron via Beach Bum Berry Remixed
garnish: Sink hulled lime into drink; add mint sprig
notes: Lovely blend of rich flavorful rum, almond and mint with lingering citrus kick.

name: Mezcal Mai Tai
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Yellow Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients over ice in a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds and dump into a double old fashioned glass. If you want to stay traditional to the original Mai Tai, use half a spent lime as a garnish.
source unknown
notes: Citrus sour, salty smoke of mezcal with a tart almond finish.

name: Mr. Bali Hai
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Jamaican rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coffee brandy'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients with crushed ice into a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Dump contents into a double old fashioned glass or, if you've got one, a Mr. Bali Hai Tiki Mug (vintage) and serve.

Note: If you don't own coffee brandy, use a coffee liqueur instead (which is much the same, but with a rum base).
Beachbum Berry REMIXED
notes: Coffee flavor, moderately sweet against a dark rum with some pungent funkiness from the Jamaican rum.

name: Navy Grog
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Demerara Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Syrup / Mix'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'White Grapefruit Juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Soda Water'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker and shake vigorously with ice cubes, strain into double old fashioned glass with ice-cone around straw.

To make ice cone "garnish", pack crushed / snow ice into a pilsner glass and poke a chopstick in the middle and allow it to refreeze. Pull it out and use that as your cone when ready.
Don the Beachcomber via Jeff Beach
notes: The typical "tiki cocktail" flavor profile of dominating rum and tropical flavor sensations.

name: Nui Nui
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Allspice dram / liqueur'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Vanilla syrup'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cinnamon syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Pour all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Strain contents into highball glass with ice.
Don the Beachcomber
notes: Flavorful balance of allspice, clove, and cinnamon, on the sweeter side of tiki.

name: Passion Fruit Daiquiri
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}]
recipe:
Build all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds, strain into your coupe glass and serve.
Eric Scott
notes: Borders on the line of sour to super sour passion fruit tartness with lingering lime finish.

name: Passion Fruit Drop
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Citrus Vodka'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}]
recipe:
Build all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a sugared lemon.
source unknown
notes: Sweet passion fruit, tart passion fruit against a citrus sour zing.

name: Pearl Diver
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Demerara Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gardenia Mix'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all the ingredients into a blender with 1/2 cup crushed ice and blend on high for 20 seconds or until a nice rich foam appears. Strain (or dump if you are being lazy) into a tiki mug or Pearl Diver glass if you can find one. Top with crushed ice and garnish with an orchid and pineapple leaf. We also used an old fashioned glass because it was simple.
Beachbum Berry's Sippin' Safari
notes: Coconut, allspice, nutmeg, citrus and a bit of rich rum greets your senses with every sip

name: Pieces of Eight
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}]
recipe:
Build all ingredients in your cocktail shaker with crushed ice. Shake quickly for about five seconds and dump contents into a tall glass and garnish.
Beachbum Berry Remixed, A Gallery of Tiki Drinks
notes: Flavorful passion fruit balanced against sour citrus notes and a driving rum flavor. Delicious tropical appeal.

name: Pinky Gonzales
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Reposado Tequila'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Blanco Tequila'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orange Liqueur'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}]
recipe:
Shake & Dump (with ice) into an old fashioned glass, garnish with spent lime & mint sprig.
source unknown
notes: Mai Tai flavor profile, citrus, almond with a sweet agave flavor.

name: Port Light
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Grenadine'}, {'amount': '240.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ice'}]
recipe:
Build in blender with crushed ice, blend 5 seconds, dump into old fashioned glass and top with more crushed ice.
Beachbum Berry Remixed, A Gallery of Tiki Drinks
garnish: Garnish with bamboo pick with a bourbon cherry hanging off.
notes: flavorful and yummies

name: Pusser's Painkiller ™
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': "Pusser's Rum"}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Coco Lopez - Cream of Coconut'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over fresh ice into an old fashioned glass and garnish with a liberal amount of nutmeg.
Daphne Henderson
notes: Smooth mouthfeel like that of a blended drink, with coconut dominating, rum on the back end and a lovely nutmeg aromatic, on the sweeter side. Not too unlike a pina colada.

name: Rum Runner
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Chambord / Raspberry Liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Banana liqueur'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'splash', 'name': 'Grenadine'}]
recipe:
Add everything into a cocktail shaker and shake it all for 10 to 15 seconds and strain into a tall glass. Garnish with an orange wheel.
source unknown
notes: Raspberry candy with a little banana filling; This is a potent number, you can taste the alcohol.

name: Rye Tai
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rye Whiskey'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '10', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake with ice for 15 seconds, strain into an ice filled old fashioned glass and serve. If you want to add some garnish flare, hold your bitters out of the recipe until the end and dash them all on top of the drink to give a white/dark contrasting look!
Nick Brown, The Spaniard, New York City
notes: Almond, cinnamon, trade spices and a finish of lightly sweet rye whiskey

name: Scorpion Bowl
ingredients: [{'amount': '180.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Orgeat / Almond syrup'}, {'amount': '180.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Brandy / Cognac'}, {'amount': '240.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ice'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a blender/mixer and blend/mix for 10 seconds and dump all contents into a bowl (or a few glasses). Garnish with a gardenia (if you have one on hand).
Jeff Berry REMIXED
notes: A very generic "tiki drink", well balanced, good citrus to rum ratio that's not too sweet, not too dry. But, isn't memorable on complex flavors, good base for a new-aged tiki drink.

name: Singapore Sling
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cherry Heering Liqueur'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cointreau'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Benedictine'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Grenadine'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}]
recipe:
Add ingredients to a shaker tin with ice and shake for 10 seconds and dump entire shaker contents into a hurricane glass and serve.

Note:If you don't have hurricane glasses, use a standard highball glass for this recipe. Owning a hurricane glass just for this (and potentially a hurricane cocktail) may be overkill.
Home Cocktail Menu
notes: Tropical flavors of almond, brown sugar, cherry, pineapple and an array of sweetness.

name: Social Season
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aperol'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Yellow Chartreuse'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake it for 12 seconds, strain it over crushed ice, then add a bit of crushed ice on the top.
Boston Tiki Party
notes: A light bitter aperol, a flavorful sweet passion fruit, light tart, lots of flavors going on

name: Steve's Rum Barrel
ingredients: [{'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Passion fruit syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Syrup / Mix'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Jamaican rum'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Almond Extract'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to an immersion blender with crushed ice, dump into a tiki mug. For Pernod (Absinthe) do 6 drops (roughly 1 dash), for almond extract, do 3 drops (or around that, maybe a dash)
Jeff Berry's REMIXED
notes: A bit strong on potency, a mild bitter, not too sweet, not too sour, lots of tropical flavor with a light honey finish

name: Suffering Bastard
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Brandy / Cognac'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Beer'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients except ginger beer to a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Slowly stir ginger beer into your cocktail shaker to integrate. Then dump entire contents of your cocktail shaker into a double old fashioned glass.

Garnish with mint sprig and orange slice.
Jeff Berry REMIXED
notes: Light and refreshing zing of ginger with mellow island spice and muted alcohols.

name: Sundowner
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Mezcal'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Campari'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh orange juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Chocolate Bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Cointreau'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake for 15 seconds. Strain over fresh ice into your old fashioned glass and garnish with an orange slice.
source unknown
notes: Smokey mezcal up front, bitter in the back with a little tequila sunrise like flavor profile.

name: Test Pilot
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Jamaican rum'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Puerto Rican Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Falernum Syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cointreau'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}]
recipe:
Build in a mixing glass or blender with crushed ice, and blend for 5 seconds (or give it a good shake). Dump (do not strain) into a double old fashioned glass and stack with ice, and a cherry. For absinthe, we suggest a dash that's "6 drops" (from a dropper or 2 sprays from an atomizer)
Jeff Berry's REMIXED
notes: Mild sour, light on sweet, funky jamaican rum forward flavor

name: The Polynesian Spell
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Grape Juice'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Triple sec'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Peach Schnapps'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 10 seconds and strain over fresh ice into a lowball glass.
source unknown
notes: Grape Daiquiri Popsicle with a sour bite in the finish, like a sweet tart

name: The White Walker
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Light Rum'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lemon juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cinnamon syrup'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake aggressively before dumping contents into a highball glass or pilsner class (if you make multiple batches). Top with crushed ice and garnish with your favorite tropical fruits and/or pineapple leaves.
Dan Rook, South Water Kitchen, Chicago
notes: Flavorful pineapple and light cinnamon notes playing off the quality of your rums

name: What The Dickens?
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cognac / Brandy'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Pineapple Juice'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': "Peychaud's Bitters"}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice, shake for 15 seconds and strain over ice, garnish with a lime wheel.
Imbibe Magazine
notes: Fruity pineapple balanced against warming rum, and a light bitter finish

name: Zombie (1934)
ingredients: [{'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gold Puerto Rican rum'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Jamaican rum'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Lemon Hart 151'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': "Don's Mix"}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Falernum Syrup'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'barspoon', 'name': 'Grenadine'}, {'amount': '6', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'Pernod / Absinthe'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Angostura bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients into a tin with crushed ice and pulse / blend for 5 seconds (we prefer the Hamilton Beach 730C Classic DrinkMaster Drink Mixer). Dump contents into a hi ball / collins glass and garnish with a mint sprig (and anything else you want)

This drink calls for roughly six ounces of crushed ice, but use your best judgement. More ice will dilute the drink down a bit, but that's a good thing for a zombie!
Jeff Berry REMIXED
notes: Potent explosion of rum, grapefruit, spices, molasses and muted dry anise finish.

name: Bourbon Alexander
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Creme de Cacao'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Half and Half / Cream'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Salt'}]
recipe:
Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker without ice and dry shake aggressively for 20 seconds. Add ice into your shaker and shake until chilled for about 15 seconds. Strain contents into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with nutmeg.
Monica Wolf
notes: Creamy chocolate with a kick of bourbon to warm the heart.

name: Cynar Flip
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Canadian Whiskey'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cynar'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cointreau'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Clove Simple Syrup'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Bittertruth Jerry Thomas Bitters'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and shake aggressively for one minute and strain (or double strain) into a coupe glass.
source unknown
notes: Silky mouthfeel, lightly sweet, nice moderate bitterness

name: Cynar Negroni
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Gin'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Cynar'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Sweet Vermouth'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice, stir for 30 seconds and strain into an old fashioned glass (chilled or with ice). Orange twist garnish.
source unknown
notes: Plum, Fig, with a light sweetness and bitter finish

name: Nor'Easter
ingredients: [{'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Fresh lime juice'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Maple Syrup'}, {'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Beer'}]
recipe:
Add all ingredients except ginger beer with ice into a cocktail shaker and shake until extremely cold (probably 20 seconds), pour into a chilled coupe glass and top with ginger beer. Garnish and serve.
source unknown
notes: Lightly sweet maple bourbon, a zing of ginger and a warming feeling.

name: Spiked Eggnog
ingredients: [{'amount': '30.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Dark Rum'}, {'amount': '15.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Brandy / Cognac'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Heavy Cream'}, {'amount': '22.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Honey Syrup / Mix'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}]
recipe:
Chill your old fashioned glass with ice and water. Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker without ice and aggressively shake for 15 seconds. Add ice to your cocktail shaker and shake for another 15 seconds.

Dump your ice and water from your glass and strain contents of shaker into a chilled glass. Garnish and serve.
source unknown
notes: Creamy eggnog with a lightly burning alcohol, lightly sweet balanced against a rum finish. A bit chalky aftertaste.

name: Stone Wall
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Ginger Pieces'}, {'amount': '7.5', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Simple syrup'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Aged Rum'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Apple Cider'}, {'amount': '45.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Ginger Beer'}]
recipe:
Muddle simple syrup with ginger in a cocktail tin and then add rum, cider and ice. Top your shaker and shake for 15 seconds, double strain the contents into an ice filled rocks glass. Garnish and serve.
Dale Degroff
notes: A zing of ginger with a nice apple flavor profile with just a hint of rum character.

name: Uncle Angelo's Eggnog
ingredients: [{'amount': '120.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bourbon Whiskey'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Spiced Rum'}, {'amount': '60.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'White granulated sugar'}, {'amount': '480.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Whole Milk'}, {'amount': '240.0', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Heavy Cream'}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Whole Egg'}]
recipe:
Split Yolk and egg white into separate bowls.
Beat egg yolks and fold in 3 tsp of sugar as you beat.
Stir in milk, heavy cream, bourbon, and rum into your egg yolk mixture. Add a few pinches of fresh grated nutmeg as well.
Using a drink mixer or separate bowl/whisk, beat your egg whites and remaining sugar until they form a soft peak.
Fold a third of the egg whites into the yolk mixture with a spoon.
Pour into your serving glasses, top with a bit more egg white and a little additional nutmeg.
Service around 6 drinks in single recipe "serving."
Note: Use real sugar, not simple syrup (2 oz of sugar equals 1/4 cup)
Dale Degroff
notes: Eggnog with a warm nutmeg and light alcohol warmth, fantastic creaminess
